commit_message:
Removed "networks" panel from Horizon.

While this functionality will eventually be restored to Horizon,
when it does it will be in a significantly revamped and improved
form. For the Essex release, the amount of work required to get it
where it needs to be is too great and so it has regrettably been
cut from the current lineup of panels. :-(

Change-Id: I9c8b6e31303461a35270bea8d1ed30ad0ae6ed93

commit_message:
Add adjustable offset to audit_period.

Allows audit periods to be offset, so daily periods can begin at local
midnight, instead of UTC, monthly periods can begin on the 15th
instead of the 1st, etc.

Fixes bug 948601

Change-Id: I38f6af0a5a513f888b791a4b9ca39467030105f2

subject: Isolating backtraces to DEBUG (bug 947060)
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-03-05 22:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Very much open to thoughts on how to approach this.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:51:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

a few style notes in there.

Are there any exceptions that we *WANT* to process up from there? - I don't know PASTE guts that well. 

The idea of the wrapper makes to me, and while I wasn't uncomfortable with tracebacks in the log (actually prefer them from a remote debugging point of view), I do like having criticals reported in the logs regardless of level."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Fixed style issues -- we might want to open a style bug for inconsistent use of getLogger().

I considered catching only instances of keystone.exceptions, and letting everything else (unexpected) bubble all the way up. This would imply re-raising new exceptions, e.g. 

    except IOError:
        raise exception.Error('Failed to read template file...')

100% agree on remote debugging, however, it's also easy to tell people to enable a debug log and reproduce. If it can't be reproduced, it can't be fixed anyway."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-07 06:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-03-07 14:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-07 17:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-07 18:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

commit_message:
Isolating backtraces to DEBUG (bug 947060)

Debug mode on: http://pastie.org/3529520
  (full backtrace to stdout)

Debug mode off: http://pastie.org/3529526
  (Just an error message to stdout)

Change-Id: I1d4e17cf73e7777c3cbaef7c5d7fd18a4f6e53dc

commit_message:
Fix multi_host column name in setup_networks...

Use the correct DB column name for multi_host in the
Nova network manage setup_networks_on_host function.

Fixes LP Bug #948965.

Change-Id: Id2a7bf9a2b5173d2b5fdec17a19e364e54c9a2c4

commit_message:
Make ec2-credentials-* commands work properly for non-admin user

* Add user id to token-get output
* Save authenticated user and tenant IDs in client in Client._extract_service_catalog()
* Handle default user and tenant IDs in ec2-credentials-* commands

Fixed bug 947011

Change-Id: I97750f666ba03f32f0bb1be0c2df5ad8a321b433

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-22 08:46:22.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage: allow use of /32 IP range

The current code does not allow to add an IP range which is /32, because
netaddr considers that there's no host in such a network. While this is
probably debatable, it disallow to add specific IP address in a pool, which
is really handy and was possible before.
This patch fix that by treating the /32 subnet as a special case.

Change-Id: I38685e6f1a3541519d1f2a9ec8d3b00dd522b44a
"}, {'created': '2012-02-22 14:38:48.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage: allow use of /32 IP range

The current code does not allow to add an IP range which is /32, because
netaddr considers that there's no host in such a network. While this is
probably debatable, it disallow to add specific IP address in a pool, which
is really handy and was possible before.
This patch fix that by treating the /32 subnet as a special case.

Change-Id: I38685e6f1a3541519d1f2a9ec8d3b00dd522b44a

commit_message:
nova-manage: allow use of /32 IP range

The current code does not allow to add an IP range which is /32, because
netaddr considers that there's no host in such a network. While this is
probably debatable, it disallow to add specific IP address in a pool, which
is really handy and was possible before.
This patch fix that by treating the /32 subnet as a special case.

Change-Id: I38685e6f1a3541519d1f2a9ec8d3b00dd522b44a

commit_message:
api-paste.ini: Add /1.0 to default urlmap

The metadata handler lists 1.0 as a supported version, but there is no
mapping for /1.0 to the meta pipeline in the default paste config, resulting
in requests to 169.254.169.254/1.0/ re-serving the metaversions pipeline instead.

Fixes bug 948595

Change-Id: Ib9cb54a04170ad86bbcbbb59557be97f05de13f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-07 16:10:18.000000000', 'message': "Clear created attributes when tearing down tests

unittest will keep each test case around after completion pinning any
objects references by attributes on the test case. This can bloat
the memory used during a full test suite run to the point where
the test suite will require much more memory than running all of
the services does. On systems witout lots of memory, test suite
failures will occur as test cases cannot fork to execute programs.

Clearing out __dict__ of any attributes that don't start with a _
(since some are needed by unittest itself) reduces memory
significantly. This does require the super class tearDown to be
called last in some cases however.

Change-Id: I0e660b6c2a77c5613c5a523ba0a64c3d7f6dd128
"}]
commit_message:
Clear created attributes when tearing down tests

unittest will keep each test case around after completion pinning any
objects references by attributes on the test case. This can bloat
the memory used during a full test suite run to the point where
the test suite will require much more memory than running all of
the services does. On systems witout lots of memory, test suite
failures will occur as test cases cannot fork to execute programs.

Clearing out __dict__ of any attributes that don't start with a _
(since some are needed by unittest itself) reduces memory
significantly. This does require the super class tearDown to be
called last in some cases however.

Change-Id: I0e660b6c2a77c5613c5a523ba0a64c3d7f6dd128

[{'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-05 09:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The sheer size of this changeset makes it significantly harder to review.  Bitesize changes would have been significantly easier. :)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-03-05 09:29:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I really appreciate the work, but this sounds like a change that does not fix a bug and may well introduce regressions -- precisely the type of change that is unwanted at this stage of the cycle. I'd really much prefer to defer that for ~2 weeks until we open Folsom."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 09:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think this change should land before Essex separation because:
- we can tighten code requirements before LTS-like release to ease its support;
- if we land it after, backports from Folsom to Essex will become very painful.

This change contains a lot of small equivalent fixes, easily checked (reviewed) by hand.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-03-05 10:00:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

OK, I can see the benefits of landing this now instead of at the beginning of F. I wish we had that one earlier, but since we didn't... If the reviewers bless it, let's have it. Hopefully it won't divert too much attention."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-05 16:52:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

So, I have a couple of problems with this patch.  The first is simply that it is so huge, but I'll grant that this may be the best way to submit it.  However, the other problem I have is the introduction of a huge number of backslash continuations, including at least one completely unnecessary one in an expression surrounded by parentheses.  (I've started thinking that we should add a clause to HACKING recommending avoiding backslashes wherever possible, and enumerating places that backslash continuation are permissible, such as in the .filter() chains in the sqlalchemy API…but I'll hold off on that until Folsom, I think.)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-05 17:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

I have a huge problem with this as well because I see in a number of places:
'from nova import compute' is being changed to:
'from nova.compute import api as compute_api', etc.

This means breaks the support for being able to specify your own compute API class in nova/compute/__init__.py

We need the code to be using nova.compute.API(), not nova.compute.api.API().

Additionally, I see some HACKING violations _added_, not removed...  An example is an import of 'nova.rpc.common' some place that's not in the correct spot in the import list. 

This patch should really be split up.  I don't have a problem with these cleanups for Essex... but I don't think doing it in a single patch is the best way."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:59:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Kevin,

> The first is simply that it is so huge, but I'll grant that this may be the best way to submit it. 

Yes, it is huge, and yes, we should push it in one bulk because of interdependence in some of this fixes. 

> I have is the introduction of a huge number of backslash continuations, including at least one completely unnecessary one in an expression surrounded by parentheses.

I've rechecked all of them, found only a couple of really new backslashes, removed the only one that were evil in hacking.py

Chris,

> This means breaks the support for being able to specify your own compute API class in nova/compute/__init__.py

No, not at all. There is no place where compute.API would be replaced with compute_api.API. <module>.API was replaced with <module>_api.API only if <module> has simple 'from .api import API' inside. No logic was lost here.

> An example is an import of 'nova.rpc.common' some place that's not in the correct spot in the import list.

Couldn't find it, can you please point me to the spot?

> This patch should really be split up.

We really should push it all at once, some of this changes depend on each other, and besides almost 70% of this change are in two files which you can review first and remember to never look at them again.

Everybody,

Good, lot's of criticism. Let's stay constructive though. If you spot a problem in the code, please point me to it with inline comments.
It really takes not so much time to slide through this change file by file, and with Gerrit marking every seen file with green V it makes the process even fun.

Looking forward to new reviews and comments."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Marked the places where I saw backslashes introduced.  Notice that test_migrations.py has a *ton* of them introduced with this patch.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Not every backslash can be avoided.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:49:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (15 inline comments)

Recommending splitting this patch up IS constructive criticism.  I just spent 20 minutes reviewing this branch... and I didn't make it through all of the files yet.

Now there's a new patch set uploaded.  And now I need to look through everything again to see what's changed (diffing the different patchsets helps... but as soon as you have to rebase... this gets really painful to see what's changed between patchsets).

Keep in mind... there's more to reviewing than just looking at a minimal diff in gerrit.   I need to grep for things that are changing to make sure all cases are hit and so forth.  Just quickly clicking through the files on gerrit is not the right answer.  Unfortunately, even with the 20 minutes I just spent, I didn't do a review to the level that I'd prefer."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

+1 on splitting into smaller patches'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (9 inline comments)

replies inline.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

from some.mod import smth as smth_else

is almost (very close to fully) equivalent to

import some.mod
smth_else = smth
del some

You are proposing to add such pieces here and there, I totally against it. This cracks mocking, adds unnecessary aliases for objects and brings only some "maybe some day" benefits.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:29:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I believe it usually just shows the last person to touch a line.  Also wasn't nova imported into git after development started making git logs  less accurate for older code?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:36:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
bug 944145: race condition causes VM's state to be SHUTOFF

ensure we close down the contention window between _sync_power_states
and live migration/host evacuation.

Change-Id: Ie6cbd9bf2eee206b4a821a4b77a6dced409f3983

commit_message:
Remove 'by' line for a section.

Remove author designation for a section in the docs.  This just seemed
odd to me since no other sections specify an author.

In passing, move the <title> out of <info> to match how the title is
specified for all other sections.

Change-Id: Ie93a54b6b4b0282c63d63eed0307452aa755610d

[{'created': '2012-03-06 17:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Backports OS Auth API v2.0 support in swift.common.client

Commit 310675f7739a6a03446e8e8c4c5bccde9331b315 introduced support for OpenStack Auth API v2.0 support, but it only did in the bin/swift, the CLI tool.

This backports the missing piece so it works in the Python client module too.

Change-Id: I502ec9dec56347c35e986cae27c89578b7c9abfe
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Backports OS Auth API v2.0 support in swift.common.client

Commit 310675f7739a6a03446e8e8c4c5bccde9331b315 introduced support for OpenStack Auth API v2.0 support, but it only did in the bin/swift, the CLI tool.

This backports the missing piece so it works in the Python client module too.

Change-Id: I502ec9dec56347c35e986cae27c89578b7c9abfe
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Don't use _ for variable name

_ is reserved for gettext use and using _ for variable names can result
in runtime failures when trying to lookup string translations

Change-Id: I8835142fd19ba5f395ddef959c38167f4144b813

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/931/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-20 19:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-20 19:38:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Joe: requirements.txt gets created in write_requirements() - which is why it's in .gitignore. It gets shipped in the source tarball - so it really only exists if you're running inside of a tarball that was produced by jenkins in a virtualenv (and encodes the exact versions of dependencies that this was tested against) parse_requirements() returns an empty list if that file isn't there, so for the common case, setup.py works like it always has."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-20 19:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-20 19:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-05 10:29:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I find it troubling that tarballs generated by jenkins and release tarballs have different contents.. sdist was designed to give a reliable tarball regardless, this change seems to make it dependant on the /when/ sdist was run.. Or am i mistaken?

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-03-06 23:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

All release tarballs should be tarballs generated by jenkins. HOWEVER, all this does is add a file to the tarball which records the exact versions of dependent libraries that were tested. Since we test in a virtualenv, it's pretty easy to answer that question and report it.

The main difference is that requirements.txt is not generated when you run sdist outside of a venv, which is something you might do for a random locally produced sdist, or that is done as part of actually installing the software in to the sdist in the first place.

Does that make sense?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-03-07 06:14:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Abandoned

Let's revisit this later."}]

commit_message:
Add requirements freezing.

Save a list of requirements which represent the versions of
libs used as tested. If the file exists, it will be used at
setup.py time. If it doesn't, pip-requires will be used
instead.

Change-Id: I3d82bc7f26c7cfdf3070e98dec19a65820df0cbf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-24 03:35:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug#862664 - Improper calls to get_image

Backport of 068c782d03fe5fff793505f56623fcd70f465927

The glance.client.Client.get_image() call returns a
tuple of (metadata, image_iterator). Unfortunately,
Horizon's glance API calls get_image() when it means
to call get_image_meta(). Because the call to get_image()
simply ignores the image iterator returned from get_image(),
when the image iterator is garbage-collected, this causes
the connection to Glance to be closed, however by that time
the socket bound to the iterator has been switched out by
eventlet. The result is lots of these in the Glance API log:

2011-09-28 17:46:12 DEBUG [glance.store.filesystem] Found image at /opt/stack/glance/images/3. Returning in ChunkedFile.
2011-09-28 17:46:12 DEBUG [eventlet.wsgi.server] Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 351, in handle_one_response
        write(''.join(towrite))
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 301, in write
        _writelines(towrite)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 334, in writelines
        self.flush()
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 303, in flush
        self._sock.sendall(view[write_offset:write_offset+buffer_size])
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenio.py", line 283, in sendall
        tail = self.send(data, flags)
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenio.py", line 269, in send
        total_sent += fd.send(data[total_sent:], flags)
    error: [Errno 104] Connection reset by peer

This patch fixes the improper calls to get_image() by replacing them
with appropriate calls to get_image_meta().

Conflicts:

	django-openstack/django_openstack/dash/views/images.py
	horizon/horizon/api/glance.py
	horizon/horizon/api/nova.py
	horizon/horizon/dashboards/nova/images/views.py
	horizon/horizon/tests/api_tests/glance.py
	horizon/horizon/tests/api_tests/nova.py

Change-Id: Id4cb0f4d5766b7836a8dae497fde03092dceb77b
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#862664 - Improper calls to get_image

Backport of 068c782d03fe5fff793505f56623fcd70f465927

The glance.client.Client.get_image() call returns a
tuple of (metadata, image_iterator). Unfortunately,
Horizon's glance API calls get_image() when it means
to call get_image_meta(). Because the call to get_image()
simply ignores the image iterator returned from get_image(),
when the image iterator is garbage-collected, this causes
the connection to Glance to be closed, however by that time
the socket bound to the iterator has been switched out by
eventlet. The result is lots of these in the Glance API log:

2011-09-28 17:46:12 DEBUG [glance.store.filesystem] Found image at /opt/stack/glance/images/3. Returning in ChunkedFile.
2011-09-28 17:46:12 DEBUG [eventlet.wsgi.server] Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 351, in handle_one_response
        write(''.join(towrite))
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 301, in write
        _writelines(towrite)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 334, in writelines
        self.flush()
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 303, in flush
        self._sock.sendall(view[write_offset:write_offset+buffer_size])
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenio.py", line 283, in sendall
        tail = self.send(data, flags)
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/eventlet/greenio.py", line 269, in send
        total_sent += fd.send(data[total_sent:], flags)
    error: [Errno 104] Connection reset by peer

This patch fixes the improper calls to get_image() by replacing them
with appropriate calls to get_image_meta().

Conflicts:

	django-openstack/django_openstack/dash/views/images.py
	horizon/horizon/api/glance.py
	horizon/horizon/api/nova.py
	horizon/horizon/dashboards/nova/images/views.py
	horizon/horizon/tests/api_tests/glance.py
	horizon/horizon/tests/api_tests/nova.py

Change-Id: Id4cb0f4d5766b7836a8dae497fde03092dceb77b

subject: bug 942527 network/quantum/manager: fix key error in get_instance_nw_info()
messages:
[{'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 16:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks for reporting the bug!  However, I do not believe this fix is correct.  

Can you show the commands you were using to trigger this?  I suspect you were using the os-create-server extension (i.e., the --nic option with the nova client) and that you were passing in a network UUID that was neither: 
- owned the tenant-id spinning up the VM
- owned by the default tenant

Essentially, the dict we are accessing in the original version *should* have all of the valid entries in it (in some cases, those valid entries map to a project_id of Null, which is why we have the check).  

I believe the real problem is actually something I'm already working on fixing in Quantum itself (or rather, some Quantum plugins).  This bug (https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/942713) causes the validate_networks() method of QuantumManager to miss the fact that the network specified is not valid, meaning the list of networks is passed to allocate_for_instance(), which is where that exception is triggered.  Stated another way, the right solution is to prevent the dict from being accessed with a key that is not a member, not to handle the fact that the key may not be in the dict."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-29 04:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Update: I've confirmed by hypothesis, so I would vote for abandoning the patch.  My guess is that you passed in a network with --nic that had a project_id set to something other than the keystone uuid of the tenant creating the VM.  

If you use the quantum version in the following review, doing so should fail in the API with a network not found error (which is correct): 

https://review.openstack.org/#change,4647"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-07 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-07 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}]

commit_message:
Fixes bug 891339. Update networking doc.

The flat_injected setting isn't really relevant to Flat DHCP Networking
so I removed it.

On the Flat Networking page I included the flat_injected setting and
some text describing what it does.

Change-Id: Ibb14a76df5ff21192595d99ba52be82537dc12e6

commit_message:
Minor extensibility improvements.

  * Allow exceptions.handle to include user-defined exception types.
    Fixes bug 948536.
  * Adds a wrapper around the form/table header/table in the base
    _data_table.html template for easier targeting/styling.
  * Moves the rest of the main nav templating into a single template
    for easier customization. Fixes bug 948508.

Change-Id: I045c29744ee01f60b080f2c1bbdc79ea5acf1b86

[{'created': '2012-03-07 02:32:44.000000000', 'message': "Ignore InstanceNotFound when trying to set instance to ERROR

Fixes bug 948632

There's a race condition where an instance can be deleted from an API
call... immediately before some other error occurs during build.

Also: compute tests should not test raising quantum exceptions, as
those could never possibly make it back to us.  rpc.call only raises
RemoteError... so use that instead.

Change-Id: Iacfe511a37e937eaec1d6213bf73153aa4d4e9bf

call... immediately before some other error occurs during build.

Also: compute tests should not test raising quantum exceptions, as

Change-Id: Iacfe511a37e937eaec1d6213bf73153aa4d4e9bf
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore InstanceNotFound when trying to set instance to ERROR

Fixes bug 948632

There's a race condition where an instance can be deleted from an API
call... immediately before some other error occurs during build.

Also: compute tests should not test raising quantum exceptions, as
those could never possibly make it back to us.  rpc.call only raises
RemoteError... so use that instead.

Change-Id: Iacfe511a37e937eaec1d6213bf73153aa4d4e9bf

commit_message:
Cleans up the create_conf tool

 * Makes it adhere to the config file format
 * Puts the sample output in etc/nova/nova.conf.sample
 * Updating sample is as easy as ./tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

Change-Id: I01e72cb58dd598a74f50c2c17f102d24df325f2e

commit_message:
fix restructuredtext formatting in docstrings that show up in the developer guide

blueprint sphinx-doc-cleanup
bug 945160

- Correct parameter declarations, list formatting, cross-references, etc.
- We don't need "let" in generate_autodoc_index.sh since we aren't doing math.
- Change conf.py to not prefix class and function names with full namespace
  in generated output to save width on the screen.

Change-Id: I9adc8681951913fd291d03e7142146e9d46841df

commit_message:
Setup and teardown networks during migration

* fixes lp939060
* live migration and resize nova appropriately setup
  and teardown networking related to network hosts
* deallocate_fixed_ip is now run on the correct host
  resulting in the network structures being torn down
  correctly

Change-Id: I2c86989ab7c6593bf346611cde8c043116d55bc5

Fix a couple of small content issues.

1) Remove the note that says the Dashboard must run on the same server
as nova-api.

2) Fix the devstack git repo URL.

commit_message:
Docbook element usage update of computeinstall.xml.

This patch consists of a pass through computeinstall.xml to update
docbook element usage based on conventions recently discussed.  I
skipped a couple of sections:

1) The RHEL installation section, because I plan to mostly rewrite it.

2) The Cactus to Diablo upgrade section.  I think this section should
either be updated to be a "Diablo to Essex" section, or just removed.

Change-Id: Id2cf46f33deb4e797ba6ce31297e682e0ad14b30

subject: Formatting changes only.
messages:
[{'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

What are the settings you use here? Would like a standard. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:56:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

A standard would be nice, but I'm not sure that is possible unless everyone is using the same editor, and I'm not sure that enforcing a common editor is a good idea, either.

All I'm doing here is opening the file in my editor (XMLMind in this case) and then saving it."}, {'account_id': 1441, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:58:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, that's an unfortunate feature of XMLMind. When you open and save a file from XMLMind it pretty prints the whole thing according to its rules. Oxygen, in contrast, (by default) only pretty prints the lines where you make edits.

I've contacted XMLMind about this behavior. They are aware that it's bad, but say that changing it is not feasible."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I am able to bring this up and diff it with no changes indicated in Oxygen, so this type of re-format works fine.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-07 01:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Approved

Pushing through to get to content-based changes that depend on this one.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-07 01:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful

commit_message:
Fix nova-manage floating delete with --ip_range.

This patch fixes an error when trying to delete a range of floating IPs
as reported in bug 932070.

This was fixed in master as a part of:
	9e21a2228c191896223daae2379fcf1352cc736c

Change-Id: I165e59a258d728c222cfea0406d4bc78cfab669c

Fix test_attach_volume_raise_exception

The arguments for attach_volume have changed, but the test failure was
being masked by an overly broad check for the Exception type.

commit_message:
Cleans up a bunch of unused variables in XenAPI.

Also fixes a bug in XenAPI where xml.parsers.expat was not
imported, but was being used to catch an exception.

Change-Id: Idfb3b94317ecc13210fa221396c6f2dc10be3ac9

commit_message:
Do not invoke kill dnsmasq  if no pid file was found.

fixes Bug 943690

Change-Id: I2b1f5cc66ba6ef02219c0d4445487bdd3a541f4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-06 18:15:43.000000000', 'message': 'Distinguish rootwrap Authorization vs Not found errors

Rootwrap will return "not authorized" for a command
that is defined in the rootwrap filters but not
installed on the system.  Therefore return the first
matching filter for such a command so that sudo will
try to execute it and return a more appropriate error.

Change-Id: I77eeff229e73d55083a735af7a9029469132c800
'}]
commit_message:
Distinguish rootwrap Authorization vs Not found errors

Rootwrap will return "not authorized" for a command
that is defined in the rootwrap filters but not
installed on the system.  Therefore return the first
matching filter for such a command so that sudo will
try to execute it and return a more appropriate error.

Change-Id: I77eeff229e73d55083a735af7a9029469132c800

commit_message:
Add support for lxc consoles.

Add lxc console support. Similar to how we get console
on libvirt-xen domains. This fixes bug 853602.

Change-Id: Ib39953b804dc3284132651f29f33ad5783d1959a
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-02 04:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

(4 inline comments)

You need to reset task_state to None as well when resetting instance to ACTIVE, hence my -2 here.  Left some other comments inline.

Also feels like something more is needed.  This can leave a user very confused as to why their resize is doing nothing.  Perhaps something should at least be added to the instance_faults table...  not sure.'}, {'account_id': 1184, 'date': '2012-03-02 05:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Thanks Chris,

We discussed this quite a bit and I don't think anyone thinks this is the best possible solution.

There is a bit of a silent failure, but if the resize succeeds, the user should need to confirm.

Ultimately, I think the best solution is going to be something like a per instance event stream/log, but for now with feedback from vish and bwaldon, everyone agreed this at least gets the instance out of resizing.

Setting the task_state should be easy enough.

I can make those changes."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-02 05:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-02 16:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1184, 'date': '2012-03-02 17:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1184, 'date': '2012-03-02 17:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-02 18:23:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

Couple other things now inline.   As far as you asking me where this might belong vs the manager..  I guess maybe it's the right place for it.  Maybe we're just trying to be too tricky by having this __getattr__ that pumps everything through _schedule().  Seems that what we want to do in errors various too much depending on which scheduler method is called.  But anyway...  that cleanup is for another day, I think. :)"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-03-02 20:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think the manager just ought to have run_instance and prep_resize methods, rather than multiplexing them through _schedule.'}, {'account_id': 1184, 'date': '2012-03-02 21:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

changes incoming'}, {'account_id': 1184, 'date': '2012-03-02 21:11:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Now I'm kind of like the idea of pulling this out of _schedule as being less generic would simplify a few things.

commit_message:
Reset instance to ACTIVE when no hosts found

bug 928521

modified nova/scheduler/manager.py to reset vm_state to ACTIVE and set
task_state to None when prep_resize raises a NoHostsFound

refactored run_instance and prep_resize so they don't go through
_schedule and now must be implemented in driver

Changed behavior to set vm_state to error on any other exception in
prep_resize.

Change behavior to change instance vm_state to ERROR on exceptions

Added tests that the vm_state gets updated

Added tests that schedule_prep_resize and schedule_run_instance
have no implementation in the Driver base class

Had to adjust methods and tests for Multi scheduler to reflect the
new Scheduler contract

Change-Id: Ibcac7ef0df3456793a2132beb7a711849510da80

we went through great pains to remove this...'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-03-02 18:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I should give more information. This needs to be fixed by altering the code to check for instance_ref.instance_id and instance_ref.network_id instead of checking for foreign-keyed objects since those were removed. Not sure how this snuck in.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:03:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Trey Morris: Roger that.  I'll update the change to reflect the desired approach."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Please see my inline question regarding the chosen implementation.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:31:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hey Maru,

Thanks for your work on this. We have spent a lot of time over the last six months trying to untie network related models from each other and from compute related models. So I think we actually want to do this outside of the db layer. Ultimately these things could be in totally separate databases, so depending on the db layer to be able to find the references to the other objects is just as bad as using a foreign key."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-02 21:43:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Vish: I'm not sure of the implications of your last comment.  Should this change be abandoned, or should I update the change to not use network_get and instance_get?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-03 00:08:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Sorry I was unclear.  I looked again, and i think we're fine if we just remove the get commands and trust the values that are passed in."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-05 07:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-05 07:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Patch 3 just assigns [instance,network]_id rather than calling get_[network,instance].'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

i made this comment inline as well for the appropriate line of code. I can't figure a way for a fixed ip to not have a network_id. I think the check is unnecessary. i'll +1 this for now since the weird check was in place before you patch. Should probably figure out why the check is there at all."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Update fixed_ip_associate to not use relationships

 * fixed_ip_associate was using the FixedIp.instance and FixedIp.network
   relationships, which were removed.  This change updates the method to
   use instance_id and network_id instead.
 * Adds unit tests for fixed_ip_associate
 * Resolves bug 943029

Change-Id: I0829d110058b8799a520ab68b5fa1b2370b9cc3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-06 04:23:06.000000000', 'message': 'Finally fix the docs venv bug.

Closes bug 902846.

Turns out that without providing a default css file,
docutils tries to pull one in from a location using
very bad path logic. Glance was providing the css file
explicitly and it worked, so I just copied them.

Change-Id: I6cc9d0ca148149637104c27f6c020030bdbcfe18
'}]
commit_message:
Finally fix the docs venv bug.

Closes bug 902846.

Turns out that without providing a default css file,
docutils tries to pull one in from a location using
very bad path logic. Glance was providing the css file
explicitly and it worked, so I just copied them.

Change-Id: I6cc9d0ca148149637104c27f6c020030bdbcfe18

subject: Shorten FLAGS.rpc_response_timeout
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1155, 'name': 'sleepsonthefloor', 'username': 'sleepsonthefloor'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-22 02:11:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Discussed this offline.  I am worried about the implications of having a short timeout for things like upgrades, but production deploys can always specify a longer timeout in the flag.  Therefore I'm ok with changing this."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The default seems to have some pretty big implications for scale, no? How was 10 seconds chosen, exactly?

We need a "Needs Information" back :-/'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-26 21:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd vote for something more like 60 seconds - something long enough that a developer will wait for it, but long enough that poorly configured systems won't completely fall over."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-27 19:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

With nothing to go on but a hunch, 10 secs seems like as good a reasonable default as any.'}, {'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-05 10:34:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

10 does seem to be on the smaller side.. I imagine this works fine in smokestack, but for a handful of calls on a heavily populated system.. would you be surprised if it took longer.

I agree with Brian, that 60 seems to be sweater spot.  Sure, an admin can override it, but changing defaults like this, when so far into the cycle seems wrong IMO."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:15:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'd prefer something longer than 10 seconds as well. There's a tradeoff between user experience and false positives. Obviously 3600 is way too long, but I'm worried that 10 seconds would be too short."}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 23:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1404/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/3132/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 23:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

subject: Only pass image uuids to compute api rebuild
messages:
[{'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

It was unclear to me at first whether I should make the OSAPI only produce uuids, or if the compute and virt layers should be fixed to consume full hrefs. In the long term I believe we should adopt the latter approach, but I've focused on the OSAPI in this change because the assumption that an instance's image_ref attribute is just a uuid runs pretty deep in the xenapi virt code."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-05 22:03:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

As much as I liked the context manager, I looked at some stack traces and found them very confusing. The code in the __exit__ method was completely hidden from the traceback. commit_message:
Better glance exception handling

- Adds a conversion step that turns glance exceptions into nova
  exceptions
- Converts Invalid to HTTPBadRequest in /images and /images/detail,
  fixing bug 944846
- Makes stub glance client return glance exceptions instead of nova
  exceptions
- Rebased off of http://review.openstack.org/4788 to pick up
  MissingCredentialError handling as well, and added a test
- A few small, miscellaneous testing fixes for issues I noticed

Change-Id: I88eebfe7a7ac21cc5cd84ad84d64b311ddccf91e

commit_message:
Update for AUTHORS file to remove duplicate entries
Multiple emails per person are mapped in .mailmap file
Fixes bug 945268

As primary email I've assumed the last one used in a commit.

Change-Id: I755e98ccf82dc9a680bbfb103a0703c4d84d3e34

commit_message:
Rename files/dirs from 'rabbit' to 'rpc'.

Now that the rpc API includes more than RabbitMQ, update a filename and
directory name to be 'rpc' instead of 'rabbit'.

Change-Id: Ib7fcccdd77fae128b6de3ee490fee3d6325ca7c5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 112, 'name': 'Jesse Andrews', 'email': 'anotherjesse@gmail.com', 'username': 'anotherjesse'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 1082, 'name': 'Scott Moser', 'email': 'smoser@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'smoser'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-03-02 02:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-02 02:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2012-03-02 14:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I added changeset 4025 a while ago (https://review.openstack.org/#change,4025) that addressed the "Adds name from manifest to glance on register" in a different manner.

I just hadn't gotten around to writing the test case that bcwaldon asked for.

I'm not sure which is better, but my change is all in nova/api/ec2/cloud.py.  It reads the name parameter from the request rather than from the manifest file as yours does.  It also populates the glance name from the image location if name is not specified.  This makes it so that each image registered via ec2-register has a name in glance, so that 'glance list' will actually show them (it filters out images with empty names).

Also, just a nit pick, I think you've fixed bug 942865 (or at least one of the issues raised there, but not mentioned it in your commit message).'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-03-02 20:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Fixes for ec2 images

 * Fixes s3 image service to convert back to uuids on update
 * Adds exception for attempt to update an unowned image
 * Adds error messages to ec2 for failure cases
 * Adds tests to verify changes
 * Fixes bug 942865

Change-Id: I35331c635756f10c02b30dd43ab3fe0ad98bc28c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-01 16:27:51.000000000', 'message': 'Test creating a server with metadata key too long.

Related to bug 917484.

This bug reported that the OpenStack API returned the wrong type of
error when creating an instance with a metadata key that was too long.
I added this unit test to try it out and it appears to work as expected,
so might as well just keep the test around.

Change-Id: Ie4bcf81741a268fd8319e1ecaad5639ad8c9b6f7
'}]
commit_message:
Test creating a server with metadata key too long.

Related to bug 917484.

This bug reported that the OpenStack API returned the wrong type of
error when creating an instance with a metadata key that was too long.
I added this unit test to try it out and it appears to work as expected,
so might as well just keep the test around.

Change-Id: Ie4bcf81741a268fd8319e1ecaad5639ad8c9b6f7

subject: Provide a provider for boto.utils
messages:
[{'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-05 10:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks for the changeset.

Looking at boto.utils:
....
def canonical_string(method, path, headers, expires=None,
                     provider=None):
    if not provider:
        provider = boto.provider.get_default()
...

It seems to me that the suggested solution is actually the same logic which happens within boto?

I'm not seeing the difference. :/

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-03-05 10:22:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

in boto.utils

it import boto only, not boto.provider

if you run ./run_tests.sh test_signer

you'll see a traceback about this"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As this seems to be a regression in boto 2.0, where adding an import of boto.provider in boto/utils.py resolves this.. 

I do feel that it makes sense to try and get the resolution there first, rather than taking the same logic from boto and working around a trivial bug within a library, using nova.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:33:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There's actually an easier solution.  All you need to do is add the 'import boto.provider'.  There's no need to change any of the rest of the code.  boto.utils will see boto.provider, since we've imported it ourselves.  (I just tested it and it fixes the issue).

Dave: Would that seem like a more acceptable workaround, if we put a comment in for the import?  I'd be okay with it."}, {'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-05 22:21:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Yes, I can confirm that it works Chris, nice catch.

This issue is now resolved in ubuntu precise (12.04)'s boto.  If/when upstream apply the boto fix, both modules importing boto.provider is safe.

Funnily enough, it seems this issue was first identified in 2010 with that suggested fix: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack/%23openstack.2010-07-30.log"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-03-06 09:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-06 10:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me!

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-03-06 15:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Cools :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Fails

Are we sure member isn't how horizon adds a user to a tenant?

I'm not sure what we ended up with?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-03 01:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hmm, looks like it does:

It looks like it actually supports not having a default role set:
148     def get_initial(self):
149         default_role = api.keystone.get_default_role(self.request)
150         return {'tenant_id': self.kwargs['tenant_id'],
151                 'user_id': self.kwargs['user_id'],

but it might require some updates to make it work, so I guess we should leave the Member role in.  Sorry Dean. :('}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-03 01:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

we should document it then'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-03 01:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I'm ok with this, but I'll defer to Mark"}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-02-23 22:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-26 21:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-02-26 21:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-27 08:19:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hmm, I can't convince myself that this is correct

Doesn't this assume that the current locale is utf-8 based? Shouldn't we be decoding the input from whatever the current locale is to a Python unicode string?"}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-02-27 14:01:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Doesn't this assume that the current locale is utf-8 based

Sort of.  Locale is not the same thing as encoding.  UTF-8 is a complete set, so all of unicode (and all locales) can be encoded as UTF-8.

It is still slightly possible that the user is typing in a shell which uses different encoding from UTF-8 or ASCII, in which case this code is wrong.  As far as I know, though, there is no way to detect the encoding of the current shell since all we get is an arbitrary bytestring.  The vast majority of systems default to either UTF-8 or ASCII.  ASCII is a subset of UTF-8, so the patch as written will support both of those shell encodings.

There is a python call to detect the 'system encoding,' but that is not necessarily the same thing as the shell encoding.  It also generally returns 'None' in which case we would need to know what the 'default' encoding of the current system is.

Basically, UTF-8 is a good guess.  It will work for the vast majority of systems, and is far better than the default behavior, which is ASCII only."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-29 22:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 18:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1373/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/3108/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 18:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Decode nova-manage args into unicode.

This improves handling of non-ASCII args... it's not
exactly a comprehensive solution, though.

Partial (demonstration) fix for bug 931667.

Change-Id: Icc2aabe9c0c521732003f7013438630ebc8d2238

The "/tokens" path is explicitly appended to the OS_AUTH_URL
by the configure_tempest.sh tool, but this is also appended

commit_message:
Avoid duplicate "/tokens" path in auth_url.

The "/tokens" path is explicitly appended to the OS_AUTH_URL
by the configure_tempest.sh tool, but this is also appended
internally by glance:

  https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/auth.py#L111

leading to a duplicated "/tokens/tokens" path.

Change-Id: I2ea49289f7e1976346eff220dc3d1664bdad4fb0

commit_message:
Nova options tool enhancements

Fixes bug #936898

1. Just import the modules and only look at nova.flags.FLAGS
   when they're all imported

2. ConfigOpts is iterable, there should be no need to iterate
   the private FLAGS._opts dict

3. Output should be .ini style

4. The output should only contain comments
   i.e. each option default should be commented out

Change-Id: I15835bb437bc6d575e8311d7c55b3a29d67b006d

commit_message:
Avoid running code that uses logging in a thread

Fixes bug 946687

This avoids problems with code that uses logging from running in a thread
which isn't necessary for unit tests anyway.

Change-Id: I9c296c3c46317c9aaba7f1a92cd565a35682ce23

subject: Adds name_check filter
messages:
[{'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-05 15:23:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There are quite a few pep8 errors that need correcting.

Top of file needs the usual license boilerplate.

There's a leftover print statement in the __init__.

The code logic could be cleaner: Currently there are nested ifs when they could just be if, elif, else.

More a suggestion than anything else, but I'd probably drop the invalid_ variable setting and just use the methods directly in the if statements assuming they're rewritten to be cleaner.

I'd also rename the two methods to be consistent with each other. check_characters and check_length or character_check and length_check.

I think the HTTPForbidden error messages could be more informative, indicating what the forbidden characters are and what the maximum length is."}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-05 16:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix ec2-credentials-list to print 'access'.

Updates the keystone ec2-credentials-list command so that it
prints 'access' instead of 'key' (which doesn't exist).

Fixes LP Bug #941595.

Change-Id: I7f1e9192d40a8bf6fe3c8b3d2bdb5186ff950c5d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-06 03:25:30.000000000', 'message': "Order nodes better during database replication.

Note: I'd like to get this released as soon as possible as it is a
data durability issue.

Change-Id: I986742229e65031df88f5251ca61746b7c8d2bde
"}, {'created': '2012-03-06 06:09:04.000000000', 'message': 'Improvements to database replication.

Note: I'd like to get this released as soon as possible as it is a
data durability issue.

1) Orders nodes so that none get starved (see code and footnote).

2) New max_diffs setting that caps how long the replicator will spend
   trying to sync a given database per pass so the other databases
   don't get starved.

3) Replaces run_pause with the more standard "interval", which means
   the replicator won't pause unless it takes less than the interval
   set.

Change-Id: I986742229e65031df88f5251ca61746b7c8d2bde
'}]
commit_message:
Improvements to database replication.

Note: I'd like to get this released as soon as possible as it is a
data durability issue.

1) Orders nodes so that none get starved (see code and footnote).

2) New max_diffs setting that caps how long the replicator will spend
   trying to sync a given database per pass so the other databases
   don't get starved.

3) Replaces run_pause with the more standard "interval", which means
   the replicator won't pause unless it takes less than the interval
   set.

Change-Id: I986742229e65031df88f5251ca61746b7c8d2bde

subject: Rename strcmp_const_time() to auth_str_equal().
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-29 19:09:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I should probably point out that there's still a potential attack.  You can find the length of whatever's being compared by feeding a sequence of different candidates of different length; most will return in the same period of time, but one (the one of the right length) will take a little longer.  It doesn't give you any info more than the length of the target string, but it's probably possible to add a timing loop to take care of that, too…"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-29 19:24:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I don't think this change improves the method name. In fact, it adds 'auth' which is implying a single use case, and remove 'const', which is the whole reason we wrote the method. I can personally handle the fact that this is python and not c, so I'm fine leaving the name as it is."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-02-29 20:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-02-29 20:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-03-01 22:01:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I agree with bcwaldon"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-29 18:45:21.000000000', 'message': 'Rename strcmp_const_time() to auth_str_equal().

Multiple people pointed out that this choice for the function name was a
bit misleading since the return value is reversed from strcmp() in C.
To help avoid potential errors, rename the function.

Change-Id: I177d8b87fb4c75a4a8bc803abf017db610025f92
'}]
commit_message:
Rename strcmp_const_time() to auth_str_equal().

Multiple people pointed out that this choice for the function name was a
bit misleading since the return value is reversed from strcmp() in C.
To help avoid potential errors, rename the function.

Change-Id: I177d8b87fb4c75a4a8bc803abf017db610025f92

subject: Add reseller admin capability.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-21 03:53:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This doesn't appear to linked with a bug against E3/E4 swift, and I'm not sure what this is doing (i.e. fixing an issue) that we want to attack in the Essex4/release timeframe. If this is a new feature for swift, let's wait until folsom for this patch.

If it's not adding new functionality, but instead resolving an open issue - please let me know."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-21 10:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It adds a super_user (stronger than admin) able to access all other accounts. There is that feature already in Swift for the other middleware and we were discussing with vish about using that for nova to replace the objectstore. I am not sure for which timeframe this needs to be merged.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-21 19:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Chmouel - thanks. I'd like to do that work in relation to RBAC and if we're defining roles and structures that are used broadly, to have a group understanding of the components (i.e. folsom summit) before putting code in place. I'm fine with this as a talking point to get that ball rolling."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-21 22:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Joe: the issue is we need some way to make the nova work using swift + s3 instead of the janky nova-objectstore.  This is to allow nova to download a bundle downloaded with euca-upload-bundle.  It makes sense to support this with reseller admins, because that functionality exists in the other swift auth schemes.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-22 00:37:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Thanks Vish, Chmouel - 

I now understand the need and am not opposed to getting this in prior to E4, but would like to do this work aligned with the simple RBAC that termie is working around at the moment. I don't know if this conflicts with what's in his head, so I've added him as an explicit reviewer here."}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

i don't think this really intersects the policy/rbac world at all"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-23 13:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-23 13:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-24 18:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-25 04:27:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

subject: Allow sourcing of openrc from anywhere.
messages:
[{'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-04 15:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-04 19:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

comments needed?'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-05 08:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

this patch makes me think we are doing too much in openrc...  

perhaps there should be exerciserc that has the settings for exercises?  openrc should be just enough to run the cli tools (in which case is this patch needed?)'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-05 11:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am having a second thought about this as well as it add much more complexities than benefits. dean/ton what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-05 17:28:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

And as I see it, the only reason for this patch is to find stackrc/localrc to get  HOST_IP/SERVICE_HOST.  What if stack.sh created openrc from a template and stuffed in either the HOST_IP or the path to stackrc?

I like having a single place for setting up user auth, I don't think we need an exercise-specific rc script for that."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-06 14:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Probably not very useful.'}]

commit_message:
Fix rst formatting and cross-references

blueprint sphinx-doc-cleanup
bug 944385

- Fix formatting and markup issues that produce error messages
- Update TOC lists for missing/new files
- Fix a few links
- Update instructions with dependencies for building the documentation
- Updated base on review comments from oubiwann to fix trailing whitespace in modified files

subject: bug 941735 : pip-requires: add configobj as cisco, linuxbirdge require it
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-pep8/191/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/121/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

To date, we have not specified requirements in the main pip-requires if they are only needed by certain plugins.  We make an exception for the "FakePlugin", as its requirements are simple (sqlalchemy) and are needed to run the basic unit tests.  We've also allowed testing dependencies, if they are also used by Nova (e.g., mox).  

I think one could argue that ConfigObj is general enough that it deserves to be in the main pip-requires, but we should at least discuss it on the ML.  

We originally had plugin specific pip-requires files as well, though I think someone on the openstack-ci team pushed for removing them.  Would be good to include Monty and Jim Blair on this discussion.  

Giving this a -1 until we have a chance to discuss.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Isaku, Thanks for noting this. I believe there was some discussion regarding not putting plugin-specific dependencies in the pip-requires, hence these were kept out. If anything has changed on this, I am fine with this addition to the pip-requires.'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

+1 Sumit and Dan's comments.
Let's decide it on the ML first."}, {'account_id': 1452, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Agree with Dan that plugin specific dependencies do not belong on the main tree. I'd recommend that plugins should have a minimal 'package' structure with updates for requires, bin, etc (if required for that package)."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-06 06:03:13.000000000', 'message': "bug 941735 : pip-requires: add configobj as cisco, linuxbirdge require it

This patch fixes bug 941735
This patch adds configobj to tools/pip-requires.

unittests with cisco/linuxbrige plugin doesn't pass with VENV because
tools/pip-requires doesn't include configobj.
cisco and linuxbridge plugin use configobj as follows

> quantum $ grep -r configobj .
> ./quantum/plugins/cisco/README: ** Package: python-configobj-4.6.0-3.el6.noarch (or newer)
> ./quantum/plugins/cisco/common/cisco_configparser.py:from configobj import ConfigObj
> ./quantum/plugins/linuxbridge/README: python-configobj
> ./quantum/plugins/linuxbridge/common/configparser.py:from configobj import ConfigObj

Change-Id: Iade472f5839205d3b23fb0182844b1061cef2485
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
"}]
commit_message:
bug 941735 : pip-requires: add configobj as cisco, linuxbirdge require it

This patch fixes bug 941735
This patch adds configobj to tools/pip-requires.

unittests with cisco/linuxbrige plugin doesn't pass with VENV because
tools/pip-requires doesn't include configobj.
cisco and linuxbridge plugin use configobj as follows

> quantum $ grep -r configobj .
> ./quantum/plugins/cisco/README: ** Package: python-configobj-4.6.0-3.el6.noarch (or newer)
> ./quantum/plugins/cisco/common/cisco_configparser.py:from configobj import ConfigObj
> ./quantum/plugins/linuxbridge/README: python-configobj
> ./quantum/plugins/linuxbridge/common/configparser.py:from configobj import ConfigObj

Change-Id: Iade472f5839205d3b23fb0182844b1061cef2485
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>

One more thing, you will have to change the policy checking. Create and delete should be admin_only by default, whereas list/show should be available to everyone."}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-02-25 10:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I think we have to wait for folsom for this one.  Also, I suppose it would be possible to use the ip_range as the id for the delete and use standard delete semantics, although that might be strange due to the slash..."}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:01:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Vish for the comment.

I will let other reviewers comment on this, but I personally prefer having to explicitly state which services should run instead of having it magically run ones that aren't in enabled services.  It seems reasonable to output a warning /error if multihost is not set though."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-27 19:31:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Quick question Monty,

Does the glance/locale/glance.pot message catalog really need to be checked in, or could it be re-generated afresh on each build?

I think here of the inevitable out-of-date catalog issue if developers add new messages in the code, but fail to update the glance.pot.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-26 01:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-28 10:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-28 10:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
test_rebuild_server tolerant of imageRef as URI

Make TestserverActions.test_build_server tolerant of imageRef configured
as a glance URI, by asserting on endswith as opposed to doing an equality
comparison with the image UUID.

Change-Id: I99f82dbfce8ae506596e123dda43729e500bf0e0

[{'created': '2012-03-05 12:41:26.000000000', 'message': "Narrow race in wait_for_server_status().

There's a narrow race condition in ServersClient.wait_for_server_status()
with a false negative reported when the expected state transition occurs
during the last build_interval period of the acceptable time window.

More likely to be seen if the build_time is shortened down from the
default 600s.

Change-Id: Ibe45df5d6689aa7a8a196b09744d7fcb4f183364
"}]
commit_message:
Narrow race in wait_for_server_status().

There's a narrow race condition in ServersClient.wait_for_server_status()
with a false negative reported when the expected state transition occurs
during the last build_interval period of the acceptable time window.

More likely to be seen if the build_time is shortened down from the
default 600s.

Change-Id: Ibe45df5d6689aa7a8a196b09744d7fcb4f183364

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-01 16:07:33.000000000', 'message': 'Redrive rate limited API calls.

Transparently redrive calls throttled by nova rate limiting, with
an intra-retry delay governed by the Retry-After response header.
Invocations are retried at most twice.

This avoids spurious test failures when the target nova installation
is using the default rate limits, or explicitly configured limits too
low for the cadence of tempest test cases.

Transparently redrive calls throttled by nova rate limiting, with
an intra-retry delay governed by the Retry-After response header.
Invocations are retried at most twice.

This avoids spurious test failures when the target nova installation

commit_message:
Redrive rate limited API calls.

Transparently redrive calls throttled by nova rate limiting, with
an intra-retry delay governed by the Retry-After response header.
Invocations are retried at most twice.

This avoids spurious test failures when the target nova installation
is using the default rate limits, or explicitly configured limits too
low for the cadence of tempest test cases.

Change-Id: I6c701b24f59998a98e6f515a2861a458470ee40c

commit_message:
Use 3 columns instead of 2 + wall of text

 * update titles to be unique per page
 * three sections: Software Manuals, API Developer Manuals, Developer Documentation
 * moved the "related resources" to either API or Developer sections
 * removed domain (docs.openstack.org) from paths (like CSS/images/links) - makes it easier to developer
 * Update titles and headings of columns

Change-Id: I1be0c0f95cec637303778b80d4f61c8cba933ec5

commit_message:
Promote v1.0 to current

* Mark v0.1 as deprecated
* Add v1.0 to version list
* Use subclasses for wsgi Routers
* Add melange-manage route command to print routes
* Fixes certain routes not being exposed in the v1.0 api (LP947327)

Change-Id: Iac8294f2534decbbddf53230386fdbe8c622ff84

subject: Set nova config allow_resize_on_same_host
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-05 15:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

You're kidding me... this is the only change that was needed to prevent the ongoing awfulness I'd been experiencing in Tempest on the resize tests?

I think perhaps a bug might be worthwhile submitting against Nova that says if this flag is not set, then resize tests in Tempest simply time out after the build interval with no indication as to the source of the problem :(

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-05 16:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Hmm, well I re-ran my tests after adding --allow_resize_on_same_host to my Diablo stack.sh and still get these errors:

======================================================================
ERROR: The server's RAM and disk space should be modified to that of
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/tests/test_server_actions.py", line 97, in test_resize_server_confirm
    self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, 'VERIFY_RESIZE')
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/services/nova/json/servers_client.py", line 147, in wait_for_server_status
    raise exceptions.BuildErrorException(server_id=server_id)
BuildErrorException: Server 14 failed to build and is in ERROR status

======================================================================
ERROR: The server's RAM and disk space should return to its original
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/tests/test_server_actions.py", line 115, in test_resize_server_revert
    self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, 'VERIFY_RESIZE')
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/services/nova/json/servers_client.py", line 147, in wait_for_server_status
    raise exceptions.BuildErrorException(server_id=server_id)
BuildErrorException: Server 15 failed to build and is in ERROR status

Is this flag something that was added in Essex?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Jay,

The allow_resize_to_same_host flag was added on 2012-01-20 in this commit:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1bf066c5

I verified the changed config by adding the flag to the nova.conf and then manually restarting the nova api, scheduler and compute services from a previously installed devstack.

That test_server_actions testcase then passed for me (on Fedora 16): 

[ec2-user@ip-10-116-213-167 tempest]$ nosetests tempest.tests.test_server_actions
........
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 8 tests in 512.713s

OK

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

seems reasonable to me'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yup

vishvananda@firefly-2:~/os/nova (master)$ git checkout stable/diablo
Switched to branch 'stable/diablo'
vishvananda@firefly-2:~/os/nova (stable/diablo)$ ack allow_resize
vishvananda@firefly-2:~/os/nova (stable/diablo)$ git checkout master
Switched to branch 'master'
vishvananda@firefly-2:~/os/nova (master)$ ack allow_resize
nova/compute/api.py
1337:        if not FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same_host:

nova/compute/manager.py
1254:        if same_host and not FLAGS.allow_resize_to_same_host:

nova/flags.py
415:    cfg.BoolOpt('allow_resize_to_same_host',

nova/tests/test_compute.py
1139:        self.flags(host="foo", allow_resize_to_same_host=False)
2522:        self.flags(allow_resize_to_same_host=True)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/2145/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/205/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Set nova config allow_resize_on_same_host

Include --allow_resize_on_same_host in nova.conf to allow the
tempest resize tests to proceed against devstack.

Change-Id: Ifd030ed591d63146c21e640240398a81cee194cd

messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:31:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I am working on the Chinese translation at the moment. The zh-tw and zh-cn directory name need to be changed to zh_TW and zh_CN to work properly. Can you change them in this patch as well?
My patch is same as yours sans the translation strings in Chinese, and directory name change.
I'll hold my patch until this is merged.
Thank you."}, {'account_id': 543, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Andy, is this worth holding up the merge? Building the Horizon tarball is currently blocked on these files. Updated translation files; added sphinx template placeholder to manifest.

translations from working properly.

is correct.

Fixed bug 947027.
