revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-02 01:24:35.000000000', 'message': "Fail more gracefully when the db doesn't speak unicode

When sqlalchemy/mysql doesn't contain the charset=utf8 or use_unicode=1
parameters (and the default mysql connection charset is not utf8),
sqlalchemy will connect to mysql in ascii mode; In ascii mode, it will
attempt to reencode all input data to latin-1 regardless of the
database/table collation setting. This catches that error and turns it
into an invalid parameter.

(The error message associated with this is something like
UnicodeEncodeError: 'latin-1' codec can't encode character u'\u2026' in
position 30: ordinal not in range(256))

This fixes bug 944034 and is related to bug 898808

Change-Id: I082b7568ef9e9d2104e13aa58d207535ef201bd3
"}, {'created': '2012-03-02 02:25:42.000000000', 'message': "Fail gracefully when the db doesn't speak unicode

When sqlalchemy/mysql doesn't contain the charset=utf8 or use_unicode=1
parameters (and the default mysql connection charset is not utf8),
sqlalchemy will connect to mysql in ascii mode; In ascii mode, it will
attempt to reencode all input data to latin-1 regardless of the
database/table collation setting. This catches that error and turns it
into an invalid parameter.

(The error message associated with this is something like
UnicodeEncodeError: 'latin-1' codec can't encode character u'\u2026' in
position 30: ordinal not in range(256))

This fixes bug 944034 and is related to bug 898808

Change-Id: I082b7568ef9e9d2104e13aa58d207535ef201bd3
"}]
commit_message:
Fail gracefully when the db doesn't speak unicode

When sqlalchemy/mysql doesn't contain the charset=utf8 or use_unicode=1
parameters (and the default mysql connection charset is not utf8),
sqlalchemy will connect to mysql in ascii mode; In ascii mode, it will
attempt to reencode all input data to latin-1 regardless of the
database/table collation setting. This catches that error and turns it
into an invalid parameter.

(The error message associated with this is something like
UnicodeEncodeError: 'latin-1' codec can't encode character u'\u2026' in
position 30: ordinal not in range(256))

This fixes bug 944034 and is related to bug 898808

Change-Id: I082b7568ef9e9d2104e13aa58d207535ef201bd3

subject: Fix bug #912107
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-26 19:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-27 00:05:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-27 08:37:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yup - weird, dunno what happended. I'll fix that"}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-27 13:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-27 13:56:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I updated the format for the section in accordance with the openstack docs formatting. Looks lijke Author puts extra spaces, making the xml file a pain to read. Is it ok with you? if so I'll update the whole file formatting. If not I'll revert ;)"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-27 14:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We should probably define some kind of policy for whitespace in teh documentation. It is harder to read the diffs when so much spacing is added, but it would be nice to support Oxygen Author edits. 

Since it's XML, maybe we should get in the habit of passing it through a formatter like "tidy -i -xml"?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:29:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ideally when all authors use Oxygen the whitespace shouldn't get reformatted. Right?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Anne: 

I have no idea how consistent Oxygen is about maintaining whitespace. It may be that if, say, you make an edit in Oxygen, and then make a second edit that seem to undo the first one, the whitespace underneath has been modified even if it looks the same.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-28 14:06:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not submit

Getting some more info through another tool, sorry for the dealy. Basically Oxygen behaves one way on a copy/paste and another way based on settings. In this case, I had originally done a copy/paste, so that's why it wasn't pretty-printed. Yuck, sorry. 

I used an XML Diff tool, Delta XML, to try to see the changes. There are some problems here:
- generally this is a blog post that is CC licensed so only minor typos should be corrected
- the blogger, Ken Pepple, has a revised blog post that he will incorporate into the essex docs so while I see the desire to update for essex, he is already doing so
- problems like ova-schedule, should be nova-schedule, and the special nature of the content, make me think we don't need to make these changes"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-28 16:02:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Just one more note - if you want to fix the bug, just fix the AoE reference only."}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:50:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sure - I think the tidy is a great idea - we ensure to have an homogeneous doc formatting - I've myself saw, depending on the version of Oxygen Author you have, the formatting may vary. I'll just fix the AOE ref. and leave the formatting as it was - the time for us to decide a formatting policy."}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-29 01:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

What I'd like to to is 2 things:
1. Publish the markup guide - Razique, you had a starting set, did we ever add it to the wiki?
2. Do a "only pretty print" submission where one person pretty prints every file in the Compute Admin Guide for example, no text changes at all, and that's our new baseline. 

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-02-29 09:22:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yup I agree- 
I started to work on a doc convention yes- and I sticked to it accross the numerous pages I edit - so it's pretty consistent accross the doc.
The draft is not in the wiki - you sent me a link for doc conventions, I've looked, I don't know where it is anymore - would you mind sending me the link so I can check wether or not I updated it ?

We can use a small book for format testing - the tidy xml seems a pretty solid idea. We make sure across the books the formatting remain the same, and will have the merit to freeze a formatting convention - regarding the software used. What about the starter guide ? I'm ok to do a first test : 
# tidy everything, no content changes at all. If it's ok, let's open a bug, so we can track the changes 
?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-29 16:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I agree on both points as well. We really do need a style guide, and a big-bang "pretty print" change that fixes all the formatting without altering the text is the right way to go.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-29 17:11:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've put up markup conventions for DocBook here:
http://wiki.openstack.org/Documentation/Conventions

Let's add to it as we find situations though - it's not comprehensive but it's a start!

Also, if there are output needs that you find after marking something up, we can put those requests in to the Doc Tools team and get the output we want on both PDF and HTML."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-01 05:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks good to fix the bug and only the bug. :)'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-02 01:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-02 01:26:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-manuals-merge/136/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-02 01:26:58.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

for services (Nova/Swift/etc) to use Keystone.  Swift and Quantum
are now enabled by setting ENABLE_SWIFT and/or ENABLE_QUANTUM.

This corresponds to the auth_token middleware rewrite in
https://review.openstack.org/4675

Change-Id: I327c593a53f3ac06e2ed0c1543d2974728e70e03
'}]
commit_message:
Add service accounts to sample_data.sh

Updated sample_data.sh to create the service accounts now required
for services (Nova/Swift/etc) to use Keystone.  Swift and Quantum
are now enabled by setting ENABLE_SWIFT and/or ENABLE_QUANTUM.

This corresponds to the auth_token middleware rewrite in
https://review.openstack.org/4675

Change-Id: I327c593a53f3ac06e2ed0c1543d2974728e70e03

for header in proxy_headers.iterkeys():	
        if header.startswith('HTTP_'):
            proxy_headers[header[5:]] = proxy_headers[header]	
            del proxy_headers[header]"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-01 19:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

commit_message:
improve auth_token middleware

 * remove ability to run auth_token as stand-alone proxy service
 * only validate a token once
 * improved error handling & comments where further improvement needed
 * improved admin_token logic
 * resolved bug 942984 and bug 942985

Change-Id: I12ae25c9d8047862072b7ebea1a98722eae1f40d

commit_message:
Remove unused imports and variables from OS API

was typoed as extensions.*)
Also noted a potential bug in 'virtual_storage_arrays' extension

[{'created': '2012-03-01 11:48:15.000000000', 'message': 'Added package_data to horizon

Several files necessary for horizon are not included when installing/distributing the package.

commit_message:
Added package_data to horizon

Several files necessary for horizon are not included when installing/distributing the package.
This patch includes the following extensions:
*.html *.js *.csv *.template *.mo

Patch Set 2: Added info to AUTHORS file

Change-Id: Id8a6a007eff17edbe77d2ead236fa2067231248f

commit_message:
libvirt driver calls unplug() twice on vm reboot.

bug 944168

Also prevents OVS vif plugging driver from raising an exception
if deleting the OVS port fails.  We already log an error and
print the exception, and there's
no reason that failing to delete the OVS port should cause the whole operation
to fail.

Change-Id: I01c22ab8627762831a106b407f758f6592363f33

commit_message:
standardize ldap and related tests

ldap was accidentally supplying some of its own values rather than using
the built-in fixtures, so it was providing the incorrect interface for a
couple calls.

also adds a test for get_user_by_name (skipped for ldap) and
standardizes the kvs and ldap authenticate calls

Change-Id: If1ccce1fd9c84622bb89344bc5d5c59b059d03ae

fix user authentication live ldap tests

Change-Id: Ib12ed623baa8a55498ed34db38716e59072c6095

Unsure if this change will be welcome, but I was going through Quantum's setup.py last night and thought I could try and spruce it up to be a bit more readable for myself. However, I understand that my view of readability is not always the same as others and while I tried not to change functionality...I might have tweaked a couple things as currently it seems that "python setup.py bdist" packages a "quantum" module as well as a "bin", "doc", "etc", and "tools" modules.

I'd love feedback but if we can't fit this into Quantum it's understood, at least I learned a lot about how Quantum is set up and at the very least I can transform this merge prop into simply cleaning up PEP8 violations which is where it started.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-01 19:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

commit_message:
Fixing a request-id header bug

The request-id header was only showing up in 2XX responses. It did not
show up in error responses, which is when it would be most helpful.

Change-Id: Ie20894b7040cc831ab8fb3088378702033bc01a2

[{'created': '2012-02-29 10:14:12.000000000', 'message': 'Small fix for forms with alert messages

This patch fixes the case when a long non-breakable word
is contained in a alert message. Then this breaks the form.
See https://pzt.me/7h0a for an example. The patch adds
overflow:hidden and word-break to css to force long words
to break on next line.

Change-Id: Ic7c2c63c1be74aa0b4e667458b92c01ee6e103cb
'}, {'created': '2012-02-29 22:09:31.000000000', 'message': 'Small fix for forms with alert messages

Change-Id: Ic7c2c63c1be74aa0b4e667458b92c01ee6e103cb

commit_message:
Small fix for forms with alert messages

This patch fixes the case when a long non-breakable word
is contained in a alert message. Then this breaks the form.
See https://pzt.me/7h0a for an example. The patch adds
overflow:hidden and word-break to css to force long words
to break on next line.

Change-Id: Ic7c2c63c1be74aa0b4e667458b92c01ee6e103cb

commit_message:
Add missing filters for new root commands

Add missing rootwrap filters for 'ovs-ofctl', 'cp' and 'mkfs'.
Do not run 'rm' as root since it's unnecessary.
Add documentation to try to prevent future misses.
Fixes bug 943293.

Change-Id: Ia680048a28a75f661a136d8447ff0aaf195649ba

commit_message:
Allow region selection when using V2 keystone

Fix for bug 936798. Allow a client to select which
region endpoint they want from the service catalogue.

The region can be set via the environment variable
OS_REGION_NAME or via the '-R/--region' command line
option.

If a single image endpoint is returned from keystone,
the client will use that even if no region was specified
(the default). Where multiple endpoints exist a region
must be provided.

Change-Id: I6797f8ddf88d5875caf194913082c3fe24c86585

[{'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-21 17:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (7 inline comments)

Nice work Stuart!

Some comments/suggestion in-line, nothing major.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-21 19:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just a quick note to change the bug in the commit messaage to 936798. :) Review coming shortly...'}, {'account_id': 2036, 'date': '2012-02-22 08:15:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (14 inline comments)

Do we need to retain backwards compatibility and just return the first endpoint if 'region' is unspecified?"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-22 13:21:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

Many thanks to everyone for their comments.

Where I didn't reply to a comment it meant I concurred and will update the patch
accordingly.

> Do we need to retain backwards compatibility and just return the first endpoint if 'region' is unspecified?

I chose not to do this because a working client could be impacted if there was a change on the server side. Eg if you are picking up the first region endpoint and a new region endpoint was added by the service you would unknowingly pick up the new endpoint which may lead to unexpected behaviour. If the client has explicitly specified a region then the same server side change would have no impact on the client."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-22 14:37:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

Agree with most of Juergh and Eoghan's comments and added a couple of my own. Basically, I'd like to ensure that if a single image endpoint is returned, that the client uses that even if region is not specified (the default). If we could change that and add a test for that, I'd be cool.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-23 11:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Jay,

Quick query: for the 'default' case (where no region is specified) how should this be handled?


  "serviceCatalog": [
    {
      "name": "Image Management",
      "type": "image", <<< first 'image type'
      "endpoints": [{
        "tenantId": "1234",
        "publicURL": "http://glance1.com",
        "region": "region1"
    },
    {
      "name": "Other",
      "type": "Other",
      "endpoints": [{
        "publicURL": "https://example.com",
        "region": "region1",
      }]
    },
    {
      "name": "Image Management",
      "type": "image", <<< second 'image type'
      "endpoints": [{
        "tenantId": "1234",
        "publicURL": "http://glance2.com",
        "region": "region2"
      }]
    },

Should we just return the 'region1' endpoint? Or detect that
region2 exists and return nothing? Or is this an invalid
service catalog config that we don't need to consider?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Staurt, in that case, there should be an error displayed saying more than one image node found. I was only concerned with not making life more difficult in the case of a single image endpoint returned :)'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-24 16:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-24 16:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-27 15:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Allow region selection when using V2 keystone

Fix for bug 936798. Allow a client to select which
region endpoint they want from the service catalogue.

The region can be set via the environment variable
OS_REGION_NAME or via the '-R/--region' command line
option.

If a single image endpoint is returned from keystone,
the client will use that even if no region was specified
(the default). Where multiple endpoints exist a region
must be provided.

Change-Id: I6797f8ddf88d5875caf194913082c3fe24c86585

commit_message:
Disallow file:// sources on location or copy-from.

Fixes bug #942118

For security reasons, file:// URIs local to the glance services
should not be supported as external sources (as specified via the
x-image-meta-location or x-glance-api-copy-from headers).

Change-Id: I43763cbefba95153434c7dcdcce3765ed04e05fe

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-29 18:06:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix update of queued image with location set.

Fixes lp 939484

When a queued image is updated with the x-image-meta-location header,
the image size is retrieved from the external store if available and
the metadata set appropriately.

More importantly, the image is also activated at this point, otherwise
it remains perpetually queued and cannot be retrieved via GET.

Change-Id: Iae8b06479dcaa5e47785f646b1ebec202fe75371
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update of queued image with location set.

Fixes lp 939484

When a queued image is updated with the x-image-meta-location header,
the image size is retrieved from the external store if available and
the metadata set appropriately.

More importantly, the image is also activated at this point, otherwise
it remains perpetually queued and cannot be retrieved via GET.

Change-Id: Iae8b06479dcaa5e47785f646b1ebec202fe75371

subject: use the type and not the name of the endpoint for identification
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-17 14:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Comment inline about changing name to type.

Also, I believe that you need to change all of the various /tempest/services/nova/json/*_client.py files to use the new configuration variable, and not hard-coded string 'nova'

It *might* be a good time to address bug 917914 at the same time? That bug calls for essentially changing everything that says "nova" to "compute"...

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/917914

If you want to tackle that bug here, feel free to assign yourself to it, too.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-02-17 18:19:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Using the type methodology only will cause undefined behavior if the environment has more than one compute endpoint in a region, which is the way my test environment is set up. If Keystone removed the name attribute though, I'll have to take that up with them."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-17 18:36:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Daryl, AFAICT, it's the type that is consistent and the name that may be changed by the implementor of the keystone service. Looking at the Keystone API documentation here:

http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity-service/2.0/content/POST_authenticate_v2.0_tokens_Service_API_Client_Operations.html

Thoughts?

-jay"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-02-21 04:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You are correct in that the name is the property that a Keystone administrator can change. The point I was trying to make was that if we do search by type only, this will break in my environment as I have several endpoints of type "compute" (ex: two endpoints of type compute but have names of "staging1" and "staging2"). I can work around this for my own deployment, but I was curious if this would be something needed to be considered for others.'}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-22 17:22:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure type is the right fix, since it might not be unique across services. Name seems to be the correct field, as  long as we can get tempest and keystone to agree on the  defaults."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-22 17:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

AFAIK, Name is changeable by deployment but type is not. We still need to figure out Daryl's cases of multiple endpoints per type, but using Name (like we are currently doing) is absolutely not the right thing to do..."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-02-23 01:07:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For the sake of progress, I'm okay with handling my situation on my own until a better solution arises. I don't see a good option other than a type/name combo at the moment based on the information Keystone provides."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}]

Hi Dean! Thanks for looking into this. :)

See my inline comments. I'm hoping we can move away from the term ADMIN when referring to these SERVICE tenant users. Also, I think that the admin_token stuff can/should be removed from the paste ini files with this change?"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-29 15:53:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Jay, agreed on the SERVICE/ADMIN terminology, right now I'm reflecting what is already in place as I'd rather not rush a change like that while we're trying to fix a problem.

admin_token will eventually go away; did you mean putting admin_user and admin_password somewhere else?

As I mentioned in a comment reply, I would also like to get away from devstack carrying the glance-*-{conf|ini} template files and directly edit the sample ones in glance/etc."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-29 17:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-29 17:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-29 22:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-29 22:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Add service account configuration

* Use username/password instead of service token for service auth to Keystone
* Updates files/glance-*-paste.ini and files/swift/proxy-server.conf
* keystone_data.sh creates 'service' tenant, 'nova' and 'glance' users
  ('swift' and 'quantum' if those services are enabled)
* Uses $SERVICE_PASSWORD for the service auth password. There is no default;
  to default to $ADMIN_PASSWORD, place the assignment in localrc.

Fixes bug 942983

Change-Id: If78eed1b509a9c1e8441bb4cfa095da9052f9395

commit_message:
Fixes lp931801 and a key_error

The quantum manager should log the errors it
receives from quantum, even when charging ahead
with the deletes.

update: pep8 and less some testing code
update: checking log is called and consolidate 
        error messages

Change-Id: I8f533e8e54c5e4487614a61a73d9c8e2e756058d

[{'created': '2012-02-29 03:35:44.000000000', 'message': 'Be consistent with disabling periodic tasks.

Other periodic tasks use an interval of zero to signal that they are
disabled. Use that for the libvirt image cache manager as well.

Change-Id: I12fddd52fe587d3975004c696c65dae5427498fa
'}]
commit_message:
Be consistent with disabling periodic tasks.

Other periodic tasks use an interval of zero to signal that they are
disabled. Use that for the libvirt image cache manager as well.

Change-Id: I12fddd52fe587d3975004c696c65dae5427498fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-29 04:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add json output option to swift-dispersion-report

Add's the configuration file option "dump_json" or command line
options [-j|--dump-json] to have swift-dispersion-report output
the report in json format. This allows the dispersion report to
be more easily consumed elsewhere.

There's also a few pep8 fixes and removal of unused imports.

commit_message:
Add json output option to swift-dispersion-report

Add's the configuration file option "dump_json" or command line
options [-j|--dump-json] to have swift-dispersion-report output
the report in json format. This allows the dispersion report to
be more easily consumed elsewhere.

There's also a few pep8 fixes and removal of unused imports.

Change-Id: I2374311ccbef43e6bbae24665c9584e60f3da173

commit_message:
Option expose IP instead of dnshost in ec2 desc'

As documented in bug 901594, previous nova releases, the IP address
was exposed as the DNS hostname, which worked well with euca-tools.
This is unfortunately not always ideal for private clouds.

Whilst it is expected to be able to euca-describe-instances --ipv4
in newer euca2ools releases, this behaviour is not always desired.

This patchset allows the nova admin to set a global flag of:
--ec2_private_dns_show_ip=True, to restore legacy nova behaviour.

This does not change the current default behaviour of nova.

Change-Id: I7c71ffe63929d90d45d9c724ab3409dcdee52b44

commit_message:
swift-recon cli cleanup

Refactored swift-recon completely. It's broken out into Classes and no
longer uses globals. In addition, I pulled out the previous individual
scout_XXXX functions that where getting added for each check. All the
check's now use the same method from the Scout class to obtain stats
and telemetry.

Change-Id: I512ab50f29e1ef4d10bd3adbf1cac642308e7cf1

commit_message:
Adds support for metadata values with a ':'.

Changes the item.split(':') in st_post to item.split(':', 1). Fixes bug 930872.
Adds a helper function named split_metadata to have a common place for parsing
metadata options. Errors out if the metadata parameters do not contain a :.

Change-Id: I49bfb4dc8c34410e491cf55ef6e7f9a1466f201f

commit_message:
Add support for URLs and absolute paths in staticweb CSS listings.

Fixes bug 939267. Return the quoted web-listings-css value
if it starts with '/', 'http://', or 'https://.' All other values
are treated as relative paths.

Change-Id: I55ee4ec77cf8db99aa48c9a398e29767b200e1eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-29 19:06:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix rebalancing when 2+ of a partition's replicas are on deleted devices.

RingBuilder._reassign_parts assumed that only replica for a given
partition would move. This isn't necessarily true in the case where a
bunch of devices have been removed. This would leave invalid entries
in _replica2part2dev and also cause validation to fail.

One easy way to reproduce this is to create a 3-replica, 3-zone,
6-device ring with 2 drives per zone (all of equal weight), rebalance,
and then remove one drive from each zone and rebalance again.

Bug: 943493

Change-Id: I0d399bed5d733448ad877fa2823b542777d385a4
"}, {'created': '2012-02-29 19:32:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix rebalancing when 2+ of a partition's replicas are on deleted devices.

RingBuilder._reassign_parts assumed that only replica for a given
partition would move. This isn't necessarily true in the case where a
bunch of devices have been removed. This would leave invalid entries
in _replica2part2dev and also cause validation to fail.

One easy way to reproduce this is to create a 3-replica, 3-zone,
6-device ring with 2 drives per zone (all of equal weight), rebalance,
and then remove one drive from each zone and rebalance again.

Bug: 943493

Change-Id: I0d399bed5d733448ad877fa2823b542777d385a4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rebalancing when 2+ of a partition's replicas are on deleted devices.

RingBuilder._reassign_parts assumed that only replica for a given
partition would move. This isn't necessarily true in the case where a
bunch of devices have been removed. This would leave invalid entries
in _replica2part2dev and also cause validation to fail.

One easy way to reproduce this is to create a 3-replica, 3-zone,
6-device ring with 2 drives per zone (all of equal weight), rebalance,
and then remove one drive from each zone and rebalance again.

Bug: 943493

Change-Id: I0d399bed5d733448ad877fa2823b542777d385a4

commit_message:
Ensures that keypair names are only AlphaNumeric.

Throws a 400 error if keypair contains any unsafe characters.

Safe characters are '_-', digits, and ascii_leters.

Added test_keypair_create_with_non_alphanumeric_name.

Fixes bug 937408.

Change-Id: If9b1393ee8f36113d2fa8a3b97ca526cc2e6ccf1

messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 19:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

inline nits.

General Question: does the test code run without talking to an actual appliance?

The unit tests are supposed to mock out or fake the backend connection and ensure things are getting called properly.

See, for example: ./nova/tests/test_nexenta.py
Or (Less complete but still passable): ./nova/tests/test_SolidFireSanISCSIDriver.py'}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Answering Vish's questions... yes, the test code in this submission is looking to talk to "real" infrastructure (namely NetApp's OnCommand storage service catalog, and a backing storage controller).  We're working on a Jenkins slave to accommodate that.  Regarding unit tests operating against a mock API server, we're working on that now and should have something in the next day or two.  

On the topic of the smokestask pep8 failures - those will be cleaned up, fixed, and amended later today.'}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-02-28 04:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-02-28 22:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-02-28 22:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Patch Set 3 should include both PEP8 fixes and provides unit testing for the driver that doesn't require real HW."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 04:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 04:38:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

OK this was great but it needed a few changes before it could go in.  Here's what I did:

 * Removed the dos line endings from nova/volume/netapp.py
 * Mocked out the httplib connection from client to backend app so we don't have to start a server
 * Cleaned up a bunch of obsolete logging messages and reorganized imports

I think this is good to go now."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 04:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-02-29 04:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'm fine with the code once the tests pass for me: http://paste.openstack.org/show/5400/"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 06:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 06:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 06:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 06:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-29 07:00:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I updated the localization errors as well."}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-02-29 13:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2012-02-29 18:48:26.000000000', 'message': 'Rename strcmp_const_time() to auth_str_equal().

Multiple people pointed out that this choice for the function name was a
bit misleading since the return value is reversed from strcmp() in C.
To help avoid potential errors, rename the function.

Change-Id: I24f5843a6da0729107d52154a184d36fc2078afb
'}]
commit_message:
Rename strcmp_const_time() to auth_str_equal().

Multiple people pointed out that this choice for the function name was a
bit misleading since the return value is reversed from strcmp() in C.
To help avoid potential errors, rename the function.

Change-Id: I24f5843a6da0729107d52154a184d36fc2078afb

commit_message:
Add missing filters for new root commands

Add missing rootwrap filters for 'ovs-ofctl', 'cp' and 'mkfs'.
Do not run 'rm' as root since it's unnecessary.
Add documentation to try to prevent future misses.
Fixes bug 943293.

Change-Id: Ia680048a28a75f661a136d8447ff0aaf195649ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-29 19:57:23.000000000', 'message': "Include launch_index when creating instances.

Fixes bug 934534.

The launch_index column in the database is used as the ami-launch-index value
provided by the metadata service.

If launch_index is not specified it defaults to 1. This is incorrect for the
single instance case (should be 0) and doesn't correctly handle multi-instance
starts.

This branch changes the default launch_index to 0 (to handle the single
instance case) and adds the launch_index in the schedulers for multi-instance
starts.

Change-Id: Ifc45abf4cd9f50f732ba4a4b68c0a6242a6c9710
"}]
commit_message:
Include launch_index when creating instances.

Fixes bug 934534.

The launch_index column in the database is used as the ami-launch-index value
provided by the metadata service.

If launch_index is not specified it defaults to 1. This is incorrect for the
single instance case (should be 0) and doesn't correctly handle multi-instance
starts.

This branch changes the default launch_index to 0 (to handle the single
instance case) and adds the launch_index in the schedulers for multi-instance
starts.

Change-Id: Ifc45abf4cd9f50f732ba4a4b68c0a6242a6c9710

subject: Few fix in the SAIO doc:  - Fix the ubuntu isos urls  - Removed trailing whitespaces  - Correct the text that explain how to build the documentation
messages:
[{'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-02-28 17:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why is it necessary to install Swift before building documentation? This requirement is unduly onerous, if, for example, the desktop system differs from the development VMs. In my experience, documentation builds just fine from the source tree. Sphinx throws a bunch of warnings about missing modules (many of which come from outside of Swift), but it builds a good documentation anyway.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-28 19:46:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me.

I think it's good to explain that Sphinx builds the documentation, and since it's geared towards dev doc, having it build with doc strings included is best."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-02-28 19:51:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't recommend apt-get installing sphinx as on the current Ubuntu LTS 10.04 the version of sphinx is a bit old. easy_install or pip install is preferred, at least on 10.04

To Pete: As far as why install Swift before building docs, this doc is the development_saio doc and is therefore really for developing on Swift -- of which documentation is a part. If we want to do doc-only procedures, that's cool; but it's not really what this was written for."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-28 19:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Good point gholt on the version of Sphinx.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-02-29 20:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I agree with gholt about the benefits of using easy_install/pip instead of packages for sphinx, but the current docs say to use the distro packages. This patch fixes other issues, so the change in how to install sphinx can come later.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 20:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

commit_message:
Perform image show early in the resize process

This change addresses bug 943421 by performing glance interactions
much earlier in the resize process. This prevents token expiration
from breaking resizes.

- added a comment to the compute api change to give some context and
  help prevent regression on this bug

Change-Id: I21619f9f6189d5bdec64de47988985cbc3b8016d

"}]
commit_message:
Provide retry-after guidance on throttled requests

Fixes bug 942874

Guide the caller's redrive strategy with a Retry-After hint in
the 413 response emitted when rate limits are exceeded.

The simplest format of Retry-After is used, i.e. number of seconds
as opposed to a HTTP time string.

Change-Id: I8b1a28f964a111008b1a88d9c0f96c5a0abd8314

subject: Use constant time string comparisons for auth.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2230, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:30:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

generally good - nit on the name"}, {'account_id': 2230, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:31:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Agree with Joe about the name."}, {'account_id': 2384, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:32:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The core method is called strcmp*(), which all C programmers know return 0 (i.e. false) if the strings are equal, but nonzero if they are not.

This method is so frequently misunderstood that it is very common to create a streq macro/etc, the semantics of which are clearer.

This patch has a method called strcmp() with streq() semantics, which is almost the worst of both worlds. As an experienced C programmer, I assumed the conditionals were backwards.

I therefore vote this patch -1 until the method is renamed streq_constant_time, at which point I would vote +1."}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-29 01:41:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Use constant time string comparisons for auth.

Fix bug 942644.

Use constant time string comparisons when doing authentication to help
guard against timing attacks.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-28 20:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Nice work.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-28 20:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-28 20:50:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Can you explain why nova/api/openstack/compute/ratelimiting/__init__.py isn't returning the correct Retry-After header?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:13:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian,

My reading of the code is that there are two implementations of the rate limiting middleware:

  * nova.api.openstack.compute.ratelimitingRateLimitingMiddleware

  * nova.api.openstack.compute.limits.RateLimitingMiddleware

The default config selects the latter:

[filter:ratelimit]
paste.filter_factory = nova.api.openstack.compute.limits:RateLimitingMiddleware.factory

which leads me to conclude that the version defined in nova/api/openstack/compute/ratelimiting/__init__.py is probably obsolete.

In the interests of minimizing the blast radius of this change, given the proximity of the E4 milestone, I haven't gone in and reaped the apparently obsolete code. I can follow up on that though with a subsequent patch.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-29 14:00:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmmm...

Why do we have two RateLimitingMiddleware implementation's in nova now?

One in nova/api/openstack/compute/ratelimiting/__init__.py

and another in nova/api/openstack/compute/limits.py?

It appears we use the limits.py implementation by default (according to the paste config file).

The other implementation however does appear to properly set the Retry-After header.

Eoghan, This patch looks correct to me... Given the other Ratelimiting middleware already has the 'Retry-After' support I am wondering how this happened? Shouldn't we remove the ratelimiting/__init__.py entirely?

Brian: I think you are actually refering to the ratelimiting/__init__.py correct?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-29 14:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Sorry. I missed your reply to Brian...

The ratelimiting/__init__.py middleware isn't used at the moment so this looks fine to me.

This looks good to me."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-29 17:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Ok, it looks like the code in nova.api.openstack.compute.ratelimiting is just old and needs to be removed: http://review.openstack.org/4700'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 18:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1245/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2997/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 18:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-28 20:29:29.000000000', 'message': "Provide retry-after guidance on throttled requests

Fixes bug 942874

Guide the caller's redrive strategy with a Retry-After hint in
the 413 response emitted when rate limits are exceeded.

The simplest format of Retry-After is used, i.e. number of seconds
as opposed to a HTTP time string.

Change-Id: I8b1a28f964a111008b1a88d9c0f96c5a0abd8314
"}]
commit_message:
Provide retry-after guidance on throttled requests

Fixes bug 942874

Guide the caller's redrive strategy with a Retry-After hint in
the 413 response emitted when rate limits are exceeded.

The simplest format of Retry-After is used, i.e. number of seconds
as opposed to a HTTP time string.

Change-Id: I8b1a28f964a111008b1a88d9c0f96c5a0abd8314

commit_message:
Fix update of queued image with location set.

Fixes lp 939484

When a queued image is updated with the x-image-meta-location header,
the image size is retrieved from the external store if available and
the metadata set appropriately.

More importantly, the image is also activated at this point, otherwise
it remains perpetually queued and cannot be retrieved via GET.

Change-Id: Iae8b06479dcaa5e47785f646b1ebec202fe75371

I'm still not buying all the changes to the code in test_clients that changes file:///tmp/glance-tests* locations to http://localhost locations... That code is merely adding calling TestClient.create_fixture(), which is merely adding that information into the database directly -- where the base.IsolatedTestCase.setUp() method is actually creating the image file in /tmp/glance-tests for use in the tests. So there should be no reason to change those locations..."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-28 15:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-28 15:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Jay - it turns out that I was overly zealous in changing the file:// URIs to http. This was not required for the unit tests of the registry client. Fixed in the latest patch set.

However, for the unit tests of the API client, these changes are required - otherwise the call to glance.api.v1.images.Controller._reserve() will reject the request when the location referring to file:// URI is encountered.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-28 16:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Disallow file:// sources on location or copy-from.

Fixes bug #942118

For security reasons, file:// URIs local to the glance services
should not be supported as external sources (as specified via the
x-image-meta-location or x-glance-api-copy-from headers).

Change-Id: I43763cbefba95153434c7dcdcce3765ed04e05fe

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 688, 'name': 'Sandy Walsh', 'email': 'sandy.walsh@rackspace.com', 'username': 'sandy-walsh'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2660, 'name': 'Mike Milner', 'email': 'milner@blissisland.ca', 'username': 'milner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-23 21:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Looks good, but you need to add yourself to Authors. :)  Unit tests fail until you're in there."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-02-23 21:57:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What is the launch index used for anyway?

Is it just informational for, let's say, a progress indicator?"}, {'account_id': 2660, 'date': '2012-02-24 01:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2660, 'date': '2012-02-24 01:42:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oops, added myself to Authors - can you guess I'm new ;)

The launch_index gets saved to the database record for the instance. It is then used as the value for ami-launch-index in the metadata service. If you start a single instance, ami-launch-index should be zero. If you start multiple instances (in a single API call) then the ami-launch-index will number from 0 to n-1. The same userdata gets passed to each instance, the ami-launch-index lets each instance look at a different part of the userdata.

See http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonEC2/dg/2007-01-03/AESDG-chapter-instancedata.html for more details."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-28 03:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-28 04:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-02-29 16:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

Looks like jenkins missed the approval; re-approving.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 16:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-23 19:44:00.000000000', 'message': "Include launch_index when creating instances.

Fixes bug 934534.

If launch_index is not specified it defaults to 1. This is incorrect for the
single instance case (should be 0) and doesn't correctly handle multi-instance
starts.

This branch changes the default launch_index to 0 (to handle the single
instance case) and adds the launch_index in the schedulers for multi-instance
starts.

Change-Id: Ifc45abf4cd9f50f732ba4a4b68c0a6242a6c9710
"}, {'created': '2012-02-24 01:35:24.000000000', 'message': "Include launch_index when creating instances.

Fixes bug 934534.

The launch_index column in the database is used as the ami-launch-index value
provided by the metadata service.

If launch_index is not specified it defaults to 1. This is incorrect for the
single instance case (should be 0) and doesn't correctly handle multi-instance
starts.

This branch changes the default launch_index to 0 (to handle the single
instance case) and adds the launch_index in the schedulers for multi-instance
starts.

Change-Id: Ifc45abf4cd9f50f732ba4a4b68c0a6242a6c9710
"}]
commit_message:
Include launch_index when creating instances.

Fixes bug 934534.

The launch_index column in the database is used as the ami-launch-index value
provided by the metadata service.

If launch_index is not specified it defaults to 1. This is incorrect for the
single instance case (should be 0) and doesn't correctly handle multi-instance
starts.

This branch changes the default launch_index to 0 (to handle the single
instance case) and adds the launch_index in the schedulers for multi-instance
starts.

Change-Id: Ifc45abf4cd9f50f732ba4a4b68c0a6242a6c9710

Add --poll for long running actions.

This will block while the action completes, reporting progress if it
makes sense.

Change-Id: I93ae3d74bdd8bb1968263b24bb7c955ee5799216

subject: Speeding up resize down with sparse_copy
messages:
[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-22 23:35:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

Just a couple of questions and minor nits. I'm very happy with the patch in general because of the significant performance improvements in it."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-22 23:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Several good points, Johannes. Fixups coming shortly.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-02-22 23:57:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Are the src and dst regular files?

If they are actually devices, then the lseek to create a hole will not work, since the existing data needs to be cleared at the device level.

If they are regular files, then `cp --sparse=always src dst`
should work just as well. The only caveat with this is if
you didn't want to copy all of src"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:05:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Under xen, the target device is represented by a growing vhd, therefore blocks are already 0'd and the lseeking will work fine."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:11:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the clarification.

Just as an aside. FreeBSD has the conv=sparse option for dd,
and I'm planning to add support to Linux' very soon:

http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-coreutils/2011-12/msg00025.html

cheers"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:12:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

p-draigbrady:

We're working with VHD files that have been hotplugged into the compute worker and so are exposed as devices.

I don't *think* we need to zero here, because the VHD container will handle this for us when it dynamically allocates new free blocks. (Not 100% sure on this, so correct me if I'm wrong here!)"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:14:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also, cp --sparse doesn't work when the source isn't a regular file (like a device or pipe). It will always write zeroes to the destination and never do a seek."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

inline!'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

Grammar police'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

lgtm apart from the pep8 nit'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Unifies the project packaging into one set of modules.

There are no longer two separate projects living inside the horizon
repository. There is a single project now with a single setup.py,
single README, etc.

The openstack-dashboard/dashboard django project is now named
"openstack_dashboard" and lives as an example project in the
topmost horizon directory.

The "horizon/horizon" directory has been bumped up a level and now
is directly on the path when the root horizon directory is on
your python path.

Javascript media which the horizon module directly relies upon
now ships in the horizon/static dir rather than
openstack-dashboard/dashboard/static.

All the corresponding setup, installation, build, and env scripts
have been updated accordingly.

Implements blueprint unified-packaging.

Change-Id: Ieed8e3c777432cd046c3e0298869a9428756ab62

subject: Fix some plugins that don't check that nets + ports are owned by tenant
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-pep8/194/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/124/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

Looks fine.. just a minor comment inline.  

Also, I almost think this could be better to put into network_get() and port_get() but that probably gets messy and we may not always have the tenant id available, I guess.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Btw, I have tested this in devstack with the OVS plugin. 

I confirmed that normal booting and booting with --nic for valid networks continues to work.  I also confirmed that without the patch, passing in an invalid network with the --nic option was incorrectly accepted by the API, which caused an error in QuantumManager.  With this patch, the API correctly rejects the create server call with a network not found error.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

A couple comments about the patch for reviewers.  

Another option would have been to embed the check for tenant ownership into the based db.api calls (e.g., get_network() would be changed to take a tenant-id, and do the filtering there).  

I didn't do this for two reasons.  First, some plugins may use the base DB calls in situations that do not require (or even conflict) with doing a tenant ownership check.  Second, in the future, permission to operate on a port is likely to be more complex than just checking that the tenant in the URL matches the tenant owning the network.  Keep the two queries separate lets the ownership check evolve separately."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sumit, yes, QM will sometimes do that in order to test if a particular tenant owns a network or a port.  This QM could is designed to handle the 404 (in fact, it requires it to operate correctly, which is actually one of the reasons I noticed this bug in the first place)

I definitely agree that checking it with Nova makes sense though.  Will do that with devstack, but wanted to get this review up for some eyeballs quickly.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Nice work!'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan, I had earlier tried to implement a similar check when I was writing the LinuxBridge plugin, but when I tried to run that check along with the QuantumManager, the validation used to fail. I believe in certain cases the QuantumManager sends a different tenant-id from the one that is populated in Quantum?

Were you able to verify this end-to-end? Just wanted to check...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-pep8/197/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-unittests/175/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/127/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-29 05:48:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some plugins that don't check that nets + ports are owned by tenant

bug 942713. This bug confuses the validate_networks() method of
QuantumManager in Nova, causing it to believe that it is valid for a
tenant to plug into a particular network when in fact that network is not
owned by the tenant, nor the "provider".

The patch also adds unit tests to confirm correct plugin behavior.

This patch fixes the issue for the Sample Plugin, the OVS plugin,
the Linux Bridge plugin, and the Ryu plugin, all of which has the
same DB model.  Validated the fix with the unit tests.


I couldn't run the unit tests for the NVP plugin standalone, but by
inspection, the code seems to handle this case.  I wasn't able to run
the Cisco plugin unit tests, and that code uses its own DB model, so I
am uncertain whether this issue exists in that plugin.



Change-Id: I8c4a5f3eb151b91a1076821dc1916842510dfb90
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some plugins that don't check that nets + ports are owned by tenant

bug 942713. This bug confuses the validate_networks() method of
QuantumManager in Nova, causing it to believe that it is valid for a
tenant to plug into a particular network when in fact that network is not
owned by the tenant, nor the "provider".

The patch also adds unit tests to confirm correct plugin behavior.

This patch fixes the issue for the Sample Plugin, the OVS plugin,
the Linux Bridge plugin, and the Ryu plugin, all of which has the
same DB model.  Validated the fix with the unit tests.


I couldn't run the unit tests for the NVP plugin standalone, but by
inspection, the code seems to handle this case.  I wasn't able to run
the Cisco plugin unit tests, and that code uses its own DB model, so I
am uncertain whether this issue exists in that plugin.



Change-Id: I8c4a5f3eb151b91a1076821dc1916842510dfb90

commit_message:
Implements reusable tab components.

Adds a fully-featured tabbed interface component, with support
for dynamic loading via AJAX and class-based views to handle
the heavy lifting.

Cleaned up the instance detail view as a POC.

Implements blueprint reusable-tabs.

commit_message:
Fix for bug 942896: Make sure network['host'] is set

The floating ip mixin requires network['host'] to be set.  We now set it
during create_network and also update it at startup time to make sure it is
set.

Change-Id: Ide0fe265d08a2ef322d9f7b6bfed5ba8b510c246

and redirects to the login page then.

Fixes bug 929309

Note: The logic is that LoginView doesn't accept
request.is_ajax() and throws 401(Unauthorized) exception.
Then, modals.js checks the response for 401 and redirects
to the URL specified in the header(or reloads page).

Change-Id: Ic90658bff2eabfe630b1f9912cf4a5aa45edf58e

Note: The authentication logic is slightly changed -
login_required decorator is replaced by a Horizon decorator,
that raises NotAuthorized exception instead redirecting
to login page. Then, all unauthorized requests are now

the request is from ajax call(then returns error 401),

requested page in ?next= variable.

commit_message:
Prevents unauth'd view calls from popping up login in modal window.

Fixes bug 929309

Note: The authentication logic is slightly changed -
login_required decorator is replaced by a Horizon decorator,
that raises NotAuthorized exception instead redirecting
to login page. Then, all unauthorized requests are now
handled by Horizon Middleware, and performs a check if
the request is from ajax call(then returns error 401),
otherwise - redirects to login page, persisting the
requested page in ?next= variable.

Change-Id: Ic90658bff2eabfe630b1f9912cf4a5aa45edf58e

guard against timing attacks.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-28 06:21:31.000000000', 'message': 'Provide request to Middleware.process_response()

It appears that no middleware has taken advantage of
the builtin process_response(response) convention,
because a reference to the original request is
typically necessary to build an appropriate response.

Change-Id: If032261974eb1d756abdbd5b18892091978e2a07
'}]
commit_message:
Provide request to Middleware.process_response()

It appears that no middleware has taken advantage of
the builtin process_response(response) convention,
because a reference to the original request is
typically necessary to build an appropriate response.

Change-Id: If032261974eb1d756abdbd5b18892091978e2a07

commit_message:
Remove admin_user/admin_password from auth_token.

Removes support for 'admin_user' and 'admin_password' from the
auth_token middleware.

Fixes LP Bug #942895.

Change-Id: I0780d33866e6369cef0835286dfe3af34a392a86

commit_message:
LDAP member defaults

sets the default attributes required for Tenants as well as
other classes that will use the groupOfNames  object class in the future

Change-Id: I77d0e1bdb46e64105d12e0565dd1112d8e6c3f17

subject: Fix issue starting nova-compute w/ XenServer
messages:
[{'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Currently there are no test suites which cover unit testing of the XenAPIConnection, this issue and fix was found/tested on a functional install.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Please add a first line to commit reason to describe the change..

Also:  I think this needs further work.  I think your patch will leave the compute node table with an empty dom0 host on a fresh install.  Looking at this, I don't believe the code is needed where it is.  Instead, the dom0 hostname could be set in update_available_resource() in nova/virt/xenapi_conn.py.. 

While that is a periodic task, I believe the periodic task runs immediately when compute manager is inited."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'created': '2012-02-28 22:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue starting nova-compute w/ XenServer

In a fresh-install environment, nova-compute will fail to start
due to missing record in compute_nodes table. I have moved the
db update to be included in the update_available_resources function.

Fixes bug 942893

Change-Id: I4b4f6a493ef0bbe81224c7408d0985e14fa9f1bc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue starting nova-compute w/ XenServer

In a fresh-install environment, nova-compute will fail to start
due to missing record in compute_nodes table. I have moved the
db update to be included in the update_available_resources function.

Fixes bug 942893

commit_message:
Blueprint cli-auth: common cli args

Add --auth_url, --username and --password and OS_* env vars as
aliases to --auth, --user and --key.

Default to --auth-version=2.0 if none of --auth, --user or --key
are set or if OS_AUTH_URL is set.

Ensure trailing '/' is present in --auth so URLs are created correctly.

Fixes lp925212

Change-Id: Ic0008c5d5c1ab4fddbaab5d982ab60fed2c50019

commit_message:
Make scheduler filters more pluggable

Filters are supposed to be pluggable, but they are not, since you have
to modify __init__.py.

This adds a --scheduler_availabile_filters setting which replaces the
hardcoding in __init__.py.  This setting is a MultiStr (a list, which
you can specify more than once) containing the full paths to filter
classes to make available to the scheduler.  Using a value of
'nova.scheduler.filters.standard_filters' maps to all standard filters
included in nova under nova.scheduler.filters.  This is the default
setting and matches what was in __init__.py before.

Also renamed --default_host_filters to --scheduler_default_filters to
make the flag a bit more clear.

Change-Id: I10eb54e9982b6d42316adfb2cc2600b44a9c3bdf

clayg helped me track down the following:

+ nova volume-attach bc812580-340c-43a6-bc64-494f892fab7d 1 /dev/vdb
+ timeout 60 sh -c 'while ! nova volume-list | grep myvol-10a5bb97 | grep in-use; do sleep 1; done'

++ nova volume-list
++ grep myvol-10a5bb97
++ sed 's/ //g'
++ cut '-d|' -f6
++ head -1
Volume not attached to correct instance
+ VOL_ATTACH=None
+ [[ None != bc812580-340c-43a6-bc64-494f892fab7d ]]
+ echo 'Volume not attached to correct instance'
+ exit 1

So the test seems to be using the user readable table to get the data which seems like a bad idea IMHO.  Either way I'm not sure what is the right way to get the test fixed?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-27 16:31:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

commit_message:
Use constant time string comparisons for auth.

Fix bug 942644.

Use constant time string comparisons when doing authentication to help
guard against timing attacks.

Change-Id: Iaaefb13f7618b06834630d9ccb97aff056b4bf4c

Updated explaining how we need a pkg for RHEL 6.2.

For RHEL 6.2 devs openldap-devel for python-ldap for venv.
This update will be to mention that is required.

subject: Handle KeyError in _get_admin_auth_token.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-28 17:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-28 17:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Would it be possible to raise an error message instead of returning None? What is being returned from the call to Keystone? Any error information in there?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-28 17:50:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jay: Currently what happens is the same thing that would happen if your admin_token was incorrect. It should give you back a HTTPUnauthorized.

We could put some logging statements in... however this middleware currently isn't using logging. Long term I think the right thing to do here would be to move this into openstack-common and then make use of a common logging setup to provide better feedback.

Does this seem reasonable?"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-28 19:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-28 16:58:59.000000000', 'message': "Handle KeyError in _get_admin_auth_token.

Updates the _get_admin_auth_token so that it more gracefully
handles KeyError's.
Also adds a conn.close to the _get_admin_auth_token method.

Fixes LP Bug #942247.

Change-Id: I2826f1b02bc7fd46c02ab3d15d88f76b9a8457f0
"}]
commit_message:
Handle KeyError in _get_admin_auth_token.

Updates the _get_admin_auth_token so that it more gracefully
handles KeyError's.
Also adds a conn.close to the _get_admin_auth_token method.

Fixes LP Bug #942247.

Change-Id: I2826f1b02bc7fd46c02ab3d15d88f76b9a8457f0

commit_message:
Rename zones table to cells and Instance.zone_name to cell_name

Vish made an executive decision to use the term 'Cell' to refer to the
former 'Zone'.  :)  This fixes up the core code required for the future
Cells branch.

Change-Id: Iff0fb01f0c2862a646bfb2d3fd4e218f1d2b7a93

commit_message:
Add NoopFirewallDriver

It is possible that the firewall is managed by an external network
service, therefore we need a firewall driver which does nothing.

Change-Id: Icfda92534421fa908b398acd8a811c01d4bc3dbd

commit_message:
Do not hit the network_api every poll

* Store only the mac address in the bw cache
* Gather bw records by the list of macs from an instance
* Fixed LP940069

Change-Id: I58ccb314d1fcd218ddd0bbd7857223e6435952fb

[{'created': '2012-02-28 07:36:45.000000000', 'message': "TypeError API exceptions get logged incorrectly

Fixes bug 942431

LOG.exception() always logs sys.exc_info() which does not always
represent the real exception we want to log.  This changes the wsgi
ResourceExceptionHandler context manager to LOG.error() the traeback
info that's passed to __exit__()

Change-Id: I0c3728a9ee740597feb828a513aea76e7849efc6
"}]
commit_message:
TypeError API exceptions get logged incorrectly

Fixes bug 942431

LOG.exception() always logs sys.exc_info() which does not always
represent the real exception we want to log.  This changes the wsgi
ResourceExceptionHandler context manager to LOG.error() the traeback
info that's passed to __exit__()

Change-Id: I0c3728a9ee740597feb828a513aea76e7849efc6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-28 11:20:12.000000000', 'message': "Progress bar causes intermittent test failure.

I'm seeing intermittent failures on:

  glance.tests.functional.test_misc:TestMiscellaneous
    test_api_treats_size_as_a_normal_property

with a 'glance show' command failing with:

  STDERR: /bin/sh: line 1: $'\b\b\b\b\b\b[100%]': command not found

apparently due to leakage of the progress bar output associated
with the previously execute 'glance add' command.

Work-around by enabling silent-upload.

Change-Id: Ib23e0a1f042d8e7950bddc485696a69338cf8620
"}, {'created': '2012-02-28 11:21:11.000000000', 'message': "Progress bar causes intermittent test failure.

apparently due to leakage of the progress bar output associated
with the previously executed 'glance add' command.

Change-Id: Ib23e0a1f042d8e7950bddc485696a69338cf8620
"}, {'created': '2012-02-28 12:31:22.000000000', 'message': "Progress bar causes intermittent test failures

    test_api_treats_size_as_a_normal_property

with a 'glance show' command failing with:

  STDERR: /bin/sh: line 1: $'\b\b\b\b\b\b[100%]': command not found

apparently due to leakage of the progress bar output associated
with the previously executed 'glance add' command.

For the same reason, I see failures on:

  glance.tests.functional.test_bin_glance:TestBinGlance
    test_show_image_format

Work-around by enabling silent-upload so that test are reliably green.

Change-Id: Ib23e0a1f042d8e7950bddc485696a69338cf8620
"}]
commit_message:
Progress bar causes intermittent test failures

I'm seeing intermittent failures on:

  glance.tests.functional.test_misc:TestMiscellaneous
    test_api_treats_size_as_a_normal_property

with a 'glance show' command failing with:

  STDERR: /bin/sh: line 1: $'\b\b\b\b\b\b[100%]': command not found

apparently due to leakage of the progress bar output associated
with the previously executed 'glance add' command.

For the same reason, I see failures on:

  glance.tests.functional.test_bin_glance:TestBinGlance
    test_show_image_format

Work-around by enabling silent-upload so that test are reliably green.

Change-Id: Ib23e0a1f042d8e7950bddc485696a69338cf8620

commit_message:
Fixes cloudpipe extension to work with keystone

 * Removes deprecated auth from cloudpipe extension
 * Fixes pipelib to not use ec2_api
 * Changes vpn_image_id to be a uuid
 * Uses network api to retrieve information
 * Simplifies cloudpipe tests
 * Removes nova-manage cloudpipe launching
 * Removes related unused db methods
 * Fixes bug 940744

Change-Id: I5fd1fb49a9e11b89062aa754501fed29874cb6ee

commit_message:
renaming pip-requires-test to test-requires

 * (per request from jeblair)
 * version of python-ldap match between
   test and requires
 * pinned to 2.3.13 to let tests work in macosx
 * separating dependencies between deps and test
 * removed python-keystoneclient from install_requires
   for now. (there is no python-keystoneclient in PyPI)
   Real solution coming.

Change-Id: I89e50d6747fb57dee7badb17bc1231d3619e3ef7

[{'created': '2012-02-28 06:00:19.000000000', 'message': "Add utils.tempdir() context manager for easy temp dirs

Fixes bug 883323 (and others)

Users of tempfile.mkdtemp() need to make sure the directory is cleaned
up when it's done being used. Unfortunately, not all of the code does
so at all, or safely (by using a try/finally block).

"}]
commit_message:
Add utils.tempdir() context manager for easy temp dirs

Fixes bug 883323 (and others)

Users of tempfile.mkdtemp() need to make sure the directory is cleaned
up when it's done being used. Unfortunately, not all of the code does
so at all, or safely (by using a try/finally block).

Change-Id: I270109d83efec4f8b3dd954021493f4d96c6ab79

commit_message:
Endpoints: Add create, delete, list support

This adds the ability for admins to list, create and delete
endpoints in the service catalog.

New endpoints can be created and associated with an existing
service, similar to the original Keystone.

The current, file-backed templated catalog driver does not support these
actions.  This requires that the SQL catalog backend is merged:

https://review.openstack.org/#change,4464

Update: As per discussion on above review, Remove use of OS-KSADM key,
        update tests accordingly.

Change-Id: Ie6f219fe989327bd61e293ce100b70dbf7f6de52

(1 inline comment)

Generally awesome, one question (inline)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-27 16:35:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Clear to land once Joe's question is answered."}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-02-27 18:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Brian, Joe:

I removed the catalog API from the identity core because its currently unused and was causing an import error when adding the identity API to the catalog driver.  Adding the identity API to catalog's core was necessary to use assert_admin() for endpoint requests. The failure seems to be a circular dependency in the way modules are currently imported, IIRC:

service.py: from keystone import catalog
catalog/__init__.py: from keystone.catalog.core import *
catalog/core.py: from keystone import identity
identity/__init__.py: from keystone.identity.core import *
identity/core.py: from keystone import catalog
catalog/__init__.py: from keystone.catalog.core import *
catalog/core.py: from keystone import identity

As Joe mentioned on IRC, all back ends *should* be able to import each others APIs without problems, even if they are not used currently.

I spent some time late Friday on this.  AFAICS, other than doing some big refactoring (which is outside the scope of this proposal IMHO), the easiest way of avoiding the import error I was able to come up with is to convert the import statements in the backend cores from 'from keystone import foo' to 'import keystone.foo.core'  and later assign as 'self.foo_api = keystone.foo.core.Manager()' in the Controller constructors.  If that sounds reasonable, I'll go ahead an update this proposal ASAP.  Thanks"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-27 21:53:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Adam - that proposal sounds reasonable. I'm trying to figure out why the other services don't run into this issue"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-27 23:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-27 23:41:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Build Unstable 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1879/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-pep8/951/ : UNSTABLE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-unittests/541/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-merge/894/ : SUCCESS"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:26:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

a little late to the game here, but why is there a service-endpoint association? isn't that relationship many to one (many endpoints to one service) rather than many to many?"}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

additionally i think the OS-KSADM:foo namespacing stuff that services is using is pretty ugly, if this is new code I'd rather not perpetuate it, is this a feature that was already existing or are we adding new stuff? if so we should leave services as the exception rather than making it the rule"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:29:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

temporarily -1'ing while i ask some questions"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:30:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Unstable 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1879/ : SUCCESS

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-merge/894/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-pep8/952/ : UNSTABLE'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

adam, do you see my questions?'}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-02-28 00:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

termie-- Yes, re: the OS-KSADM stuff, I was basically using existing code as an example without realizing how legacy that stuff was.  I can adjust to work more like tenant operations whic, AFAICS, are not passing that key around.  

Re: the database table, would you prefer removing the assocation table in favor of a FK on the endpoint table that references service.id?'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:18:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

the adjustment would be swell, yeah, services is the only one that looks funny like that

re: tables, if it is a one-to-many that's what i would do yes, i am not the most experienced in what people expect the catalog to be able to do (i think the feature was massively over-designed, so it is hard to tell what it is supposed to model)"}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-02-28 02:27:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-02-28 02:28:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'll need to update the corresponding keystoneclient commit tomorrow for that"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-28 02:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)
