revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-23 21:32:30.000000000', 'message': "Implement a Catalog SQL backend

This adds a catalog SQL backend.  Makes use of 3 tables: endpoint,
service and service_endpoint_association.  Services and endpoints are
joined via the association table.  New sqlalchemy models have been defined
in keystone/catalog/backends/sql.py and are imported during the initial
migration (v001).

Configuring the service catalog is possible with changes to
python-keystoneclient.  I will be proposing a merge for that and I'll
update this commit msg with a link to its review.  With those client
changes, admins can now create and delete endpoints that are associated
with existing services. Existing service commands on the client-side work
as expected against this new backend.  This driver's get_catalog method
properly translates existing services, endpoints and relatoins into something
consumable by keystone non-admin users / clients.

Change-Id: Icc11889920744c36255f06356744cb247d79f4aa
"}, {'created': '2012-02-23 21:34:44.000000000', 'message': "Implement a Catalog SQL backend

commit_message:
Implement a Catalog SQL backend

This adds a catalog SQL backend.  Makes use of 3 tables: endpoint,
service and service_endpoint_association.  Services and endpoints are
joined via the association table.  New sqlalchemy models have been defined
in keystone/catalog/backends/sql.py and are imported during the initial
migration (v001).

Configuring the service catalog is possible with changes to
python-keystoneclient.  I will be proposing a merge for that and I'll
update this commit msg with a link to its review.  With those client
changes, admins can now create and delete endpoints that are associated
with existing services. Existing service commands on the client-side work
as expected against this new backend.  This driver's get_catalog method
properly translates existing services, endpoints and relatoins into something
consumable by keystone non-admin users / clients.

Update: Some cleanup as per bcwaldon's suggestions

Update: Match functionality of existing catalog backend by returning
        IDs instead of sql objects for list_services() and list_endpoints()

Update: pep8 fixes

Update (1/2): Remove legacy OS-KSADM stuff

Update (2/2): Remove ServiceEndpointAssociation table/model
              in favor of a FK, endpoint.service_id -> service.id

Resolves bug 928053

Change-Id: Icc11889920744c36255f06356744cb247d79f4aa

commit_message:
Set tenantName to 'admin' in get_admin_auth_token.

Sets the tenantName to 'admin' in get_admin_auth_token. This
is required because user-only roles are currently not supported.
Give that wsgi is hard coded to check for 'role:admin' this
seems to be a reasonable thing to do. In the future it would be nice
to add a custom admin_role setting in the config file so the
role wouldn't be hard coded to 'admin'.

Also removes unused version of get_admin_auth_token.

Fixes LP Bug #939015.

Change-Id: I545b458e31c8a44a5a69cad1e875f0fe02956246

(16 inline comments)

The code looks in quite a good shape, with only a few, minor, changes need, in my opinion.

However, I put '-1' as a score for my review as I have two concerns:
1) The README file is quite empty at the moment, whereas it is my opinion that it should include enough information for deploying the plugin and the agent
2) The plugin is currently untestable, even for the unit tests, unless I'm not seeing something obvious. This is my major concern at the moment, I think this should be discussed with the project lead (Dan) and other core members.

Once again, please accept my apologies in the delay for

workaround is cd <quantum src>/quantum/tests/unit; ln -s ../../../etc ./

$ PLUGIN_DIR=quantum/plugins/linuxbridge ./run_tests.sh -V

Unfortunately, I don't think refactoring out the code into a base plugin class in this way will work, as the "driver" model prevents some other changes that we want to make to the OVS plugin (essentially, the driver model only gives a hook to change behavior when networks are created or deleted.  It doesn't let us modify how other plugin calls are handled (e.g., modify the behavior of get_port in order to implement an extension).  At the limit, the driver-interface would end up having to match the plugin-interface, so we might was well just have both plugins implement the plugin interface directly.  

Since we're getting really close to the E-4 deadline (next tuesday), so if you still want to get this into E-4, how about you rework the patch so that it does not modify the existing OVS plugin at all, even if that means duplicating some code.  We can then merge it in and then see functionality we might be able to pull out into a shared library that both plugins call (thus reducing the amount of duplicated code, while retaining full flexibility to change both plugins in the future).  We have some changes that will be coming into the OVS plugin in the future as well, so this would be best to avoid conflicts.  

One other comment: 
- the setup_* scripts will be going away, as those packaging quantum plugins for distros don't actually use them.  If you have instructions to those packaging your plugin, please put them in a README or INSTALL file.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(7 inline comments)

I haven't run this yet, but I don't see any major issues.  Already agreed that we'll merge first and deal with code duplication later (as we've let this review drag out far to long as is).  Some minor comments below."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Great, I think we're getting close.  Note: if this review isn't quite done by tuesday, I'm OK with it taking another day to two to get the unit tests right.  

Does running the following work for you?  This is the standard way of running the existing unit tests against a particular plugin: 

PLUGIN_DIR=quantum/plugins/ryu/ ./run_tests.sh -N 

I get all kinds of errors, due to a failure to import ryu.app"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Ok, I think there was some confusion here, as my original problem was that ALL of the unit tests where failing for me (this seems fixed).  

The issue you were mentioning was something that causes a few extension tests to fail (we hadn't been treating that failure as critical for plugins that do not have extensions, but it looks like you cleaned it up anyway, which is great!). 

I'll take another pass through the code just to confirm that existing concerns (particularly the monkey-patching) are cleaned up, but I think we're hopefully about good to go with this one."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

one minor concern:  why are both mox and mock required?  Other openstack projects seem to just use mox.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Maru.  Thanks for the info on mock, makes sense.  

Sounds like we just need a few minor tweaks based on Maru's comments... almost there!"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (7 inline comments)

In my final check, I saw a couple of odd looking import statements that I'd like you to comment on.  

A few other minor comments/questions, but other than that I don't see any blockers for me.  

Maru, Salvatore, are either of you planning on re-reviewing this soon?  Technically I'll need Salvatore to sign off, since Maru is not yet a core dev (hope to change that soon!)"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Approved

Ok, let's get this puppy in :)"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

urgh... kind of figured this might need a rebase.

btw, I think this and another recent branch added mox to the pip-requires, so that may be the conflict.  Assuming the rebase is really minor, just let me know and I can re-approve.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

rebase was quite simple.  I rechecked the files and am approving directly.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(40 inline comments)

Looks pretty good.  Some cleanup required, though:

 - many PEP8 or other minor stylistic issues
 - there is a bug in quantum/plugins/ryu/db/api.py
 - the monkeypatching used in testing is a bit of a concern, and should be avoided if at all possible"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(7 inline comments)

Much improved, thank you!  Lots of changes so there are a few minor nits, including some possible bugs in ryu_quantum_agent.py (see comments for lines 133 and 248).

Dan: mock includes the ability to cleanly apply/unapply monkeypatches for testing purposes, something that mox does not provide.  If the monkeypatching has to be done, it is better to add mock as a dependency to do so."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

+1'}]

blueprint ovs-driver-extention
This patch implements the blueprint ovs-driver-extention
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/quantum/+spec/ovs-driver-extension

This patch factors out ovs common logic from ovs plugin into ovscommon
and adds Ryu NOS plugin.
This patch enhances ovs plugin for generic OVS controller support and

This patch is to add ofp controller support to OVS.
Store ofp controller address in ovs quantum data base.
- nova firewall_driver
- nova linuxnet_interface_driver

There may be ports unmanaged by nova/quantum. Those ports are used
to connect vm to outside of physical machine. They needs special care.

commit_message:
plugin: introduce ryu plugin

blueprint ovs-driver-extention
This patch implements the blueprint ovs-driver-extention
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/quantum/+spec/ovs-driver-extension

This patch factors out ovs common logic from ovs plugin into ovscommon
and adds Ryu NOS plugin.
This patch enhances ovs plugin for generic OVS controller support and

This patch is to add ofp controller support to OVS.
Store ofp controller address in ovs quantum data base.
- nova firewall_driver
- nova linuxnet_interface_driver

There may be ports unmanaged by nova/quantum. Those ports are used
to connect vm to outside of physical machine. They needs special care.

---
Changes 12 -> 13:
- rebased to 543e150d6dc9144ebcc588b7d2bd66374a107730
  changed files are only MANIFEST.in, setup.py, tools/pip-requres

Changes 11 -> 12:
- ryu agent
  eliminated from quantum.common import exceptions as exc
- ryu.db.api
  eliminated ofp_has_servers
- ryu.nova
  eliminated from quantum.plugins.ryu.nova import ovs_utils
  and eliminate ovs_utils

Chnages 10 -> 11:
- rebased to a945d1a30478c644d307c77a8a85f3a08e5a834e
- more Maru's review
- setup.py: fix setup() argument
  This isn't directly related to ryu plugin though
- improve fake ini file when unit test
  remove fake ini file after unit tests.
  use StringIO when no file is required.
- LOG: don't use %

Chnages 8 -> 9 -> 10:
- minor fixes: forgot to commit some hunks

Chnages 7 -> 8:
- rebased to d6bf2b76162ba806b2ad1f636f6273e47e03a117
- catch up d6bf2b76162ba806b2ad1f636f6273e47e03a117 change
  introduced bin/quantum_ryu_agent
- addressed Maru's review
  - avoid custom patching, use mock for test
    and added mox and mock to pip-requires
  - more pep8
  - avoid \ for line continuation
  - avoid single char variables
  - db.api: first() -> one()
  - utilize implicit conversion
    var is not None -> var
  - and more...

Changes 6 -> 7:
- update comment in ryu/run_tests.py
- make unit tests pass without ryu installed
  i.e.
  PLUGIN_DIR=quantum/plugins/ryu/ ./run_tests.sh
  works now

Chages 5 -> 6:
- remove comment

Change 4 -> 5:
- eliminate relative imports
- copyright
- doc string
- naming (s/CONF_FILE/conf_file/g)
- add " check to ryu/nova/ovs_utils
- ryu/nova/linux_net: comment
- ryu agent: eliminated unused methods
- updated ryu/README: add http://www.osrg.net/ryu/using_with_openstack.html
- added unit tests

Changes 3 -> 4:
- reflected Dan's review
- on-OVS in ryu.ini
- update @author
- some naming

Changes 2 -> 3:
- rebased to 04d144ae0b2ad5618847d1784cea48a08d53a46a
- abandoned to share code and duplicated codes from openvswitch plugin
  for ovs plugin stability.
- dropped setup_ryu.sh and added README
- update nova driver to catch up upstream change (gflags -> cfg)

Changes 1 -> 2:
- unbreak openvswtich unit test
- MANIFEST.in

Changes 3 -> new 1:
- rebased to 1eb3c693b5f6f3f301047100c36c7915434f8be7
- factor out common loginc from openvswitch plugin into ovscommon
- Introduced a new independent ryu plugin
- try new review due to the previous effort was marked abandoned.
  > https://review.openstack.org/#change,3055
  > Change-Id: I17801a7a74d4087838a8a26c1b1f97f28c2dcef3

Changes:
- rebased to 9c5c2caef13fa58234987527ab6caff829a37050
- some clean ups

Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ia9fe87525cebccc87b7c18a533f48607272cd97f

Overall, looks good, thanks for doing this.  A fair number of minor comments just from looking through the code.  Next round I'll do full testing, etc.  If we don't get this done for tuesday, I'm fine letting this review continue a bit late, especially since most people in the US have today off."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Maru,

To clarify, neither of the Quantum repos currently automatically gate based on jenkins automatically running the unit tests.  Generally, it is the responsibility of a submitter to run the tests before they post a change, and for a reviewer to run the tests as a confirmation before the "approve" a commit.  Assuming reviewers manually run the tests before approving on this patch, I think it is OK to accept it.  I sent an email to the openstack CI folks to ask them to increase the automated checks performed by Jenkins now that Quantum is on the path to being a "core" project (up until now, the CI folks have been doing Quantum work only on an adhoc basis, as their primary focus is on core projects).'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Let's hang on for a few more hours to see if Maru wants to comment.  He mentioned he may do a few re-reviews friday afternoon."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

Ok, I think all of my comments have been addressed.  

Unit tests are clean.  We have two core reviews, so if anyone else is planning on re-reviewing this, please do so fairly soon.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Approved

Looks like no more reviews are coming.  Let's merge this."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Unit tests look good.  Salvatore, were there other changes to the code other than unit tests, or is the rest of the code the same as I reviewed originally?'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Salvatore, If I understand correctly, there are two separate issues here:
1. CLI unit tests are not running for this repo
2. The CLI unit tests need to be tweaked to work with the new cli_lib.py

If the later is correct, one approach would be to fix the tests and check them in. Issue 1 can then be fixed independently.

I am able to run the CLI and confirm that it works. So in that sense I would support pushing it in.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Do the tests under /quantum/client/tests/unit/test_cli.py need to be changed? I am seeing errors due to missing version numbers (or am I not running the tests properly):

ValueError: need more than 2 values to unpack'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I confirmed the issue with the unit tests. This is a section of the logs:

No more comments! I'll let Salvatore to make the honors!"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(8 inline comments)

It does not appear that the unit tests are being run by Jenkins.  Until they are configured to run automatically, I'm not any change to this repo should be approved.

Looks pretty good, but there is a bug in exception_handler_v11 that needs to be fixed, and there should be a test against it and the other new code to prevent regressions."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 01:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

+1'}]

commit_message:
blueprint quantum-ovs-tunnel-agent

Enhance existing Quantum OVS Plugin with a tunneling agent that
enables Hypervisors to be connected via GRE tunnels. The new agent
can be enabled/disabled via configuration file and provides backwards
compatibility with existing non-tunneling OVS Agent.

Change-Id: Id3b79430726b162fcb84f99df152d88a5766328f

commit_message:
LDAP Identity backend

Bug 933852

Merged over the code from the legacy keystone implementation, updated
style and streamlined the API a bit.

 * Unit tests can be run against a live OpenLDAP server
 * Password hashing done via passlib. Only does salted sha1, which is what simple_bind requires, but is not secure.
 * Added pip dependencies

Change-Id: I5296d94f6b7d0a7c7dbc887cdae872171e34bb5f

subject: Add checksum to an external image during add.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-23 22:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Brian.

Would it be worth potentially looking at a fallback strategy for setting the checksum if not explicitly specified, as mooted in the comments on this earlier review:

https://review.openstack.org/#patch,sidebyside,3147,1,glance/tests/functional/test_s3.py

For example, we may be lucky and the Content-MD5 header is set on the response to the HEAD request used to determine image size at a HTTP location.

Or we could opportunistically set the checksum the first time the image content is downloaded by glance from the external location.

Just a thought ...

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-24 22:09:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's a fine thought to set the checksum the first time an image is cached/downloaded, but I don't believe the two are mutually exclusive changes or that one precludes the other. The way I see it is when I'm adding an image via the command line I'm going to be explicitly setting the image name, container format, disk format, etc. Why not quickly add the ability to set the checksum? 

Of course, I'd also be all for adding the checksum after downloading the image for the first time as well, however there seem to be corner cases which make that method, in my opinion, much more complicated and not as straight-forward as my change. I would imagine we'd attempt to glean an md5sum from HTTP headers (as you suggested). If a suitable checksum is not available in the headers, TCP takes care of checksumming so we'll just download the image, md5sum it, then insert that value into the database. One very valid reason for checking checksums is for security, which we've just completely circumvented.

Also, if we give a bad location and then cache a bad checksum we're in the same boat, I'd much rather have at least the option to set it via the command line."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-24 22:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Good to go, we can revist the fallback checksum detection later.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-26 21:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Fix is good. Can you please add a test, Brian?"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-27 16:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-27 16:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Impressive code to test ratio.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-27 23:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Nice code, Brian, thank you. I agree with Eoghan about having a fallback plan to calc the checksum if not provided, but that can certainly come in a later patch.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-27 23:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-27 23:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-python27/45/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-27 23:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add checksum to an external image during add.

If 'location=' is set during 'glance add' look for the checksum
parameter and use that for the checksum. Currently it looks like there
is no other way to update the checksum and it is being entered as NULL.

(Patch Set 2) Added tests

Change-Id: I1521d1c4a12e43d38c3e13c0735526f4f7789952

commit_message:
Support copy-from for queued images.

Fixes lp 939481

An image may be added referencing an external source via either
the x-image-meta-location or x-glance-api-copy-from headers.

Similarly, a queued image may be associated with an external source
via the x-image-meta-location header.

However previously a queued image could not have image content copied
from an external source via the x-glance-api-copy-from header.

This patch addresses this asymmetry in respect of POST versus PUT.

Change-Id: I81848ba3a5d41e7e5b69daec491e83307023f020

commit_message:
Adds temporary chown to sparse_copy.

`sparse_copy` needs read and write access to the devices. Since we
cannot shell out to a run-as-root command here, we temporarily take
ownership of the device.

Change-Id: I891c38dbcba7177286dca729684c88ac065bd085

commit_message:
Remove usage of the deprecated pip -E option.

Fixes glance aspect of bug 934459

Support for the pip -E option is going away, hence it should not
be used when building the glance virtualenv.

Change-Id: I15d801835e5fffc8eaf4299fc0e48ecc208e3dcf

commit_message:
make nova-network usable with Python < 2.6.5

there is in issue in Python < 2.6.5 with using unicode strings as
keyword arguemnts. see http://bugs.python.org/issue4978 for details.

because several not-yet-outdated enterprise distributions are using
Python < 2.6.5 the unicode strings in the keys of the dictionaries in
used as keyword arguments nova/network/model.py should be converted.

fixes bug 940941

Change-Id: Ib1d9955677e228fce6cc8e17fddc780d1a839d84

subject: Removed expected failure from negative access IP tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-02-27 15:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-27 19:51:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Question for you inline..."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-02-27 20:27:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We really need a decision about whether to handle diablo differences by using a diablo branch, in which case there shouldn't be annotations like this, or if we will skip all diablo failures in this way. I think we should do this one way or the other but not both, and will sign on to make tempest pass on diablo once there is a decision (and branch created if that is the decision)."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-02-27 21:08:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

We're in a catch 22 because it will fail (because it succeeds) if we leave it as is, but will fail in Diablo otherwise. I'm okay with it failing, but people seem to be confused and frustrated by failures due to bugs. I'm open to doing a diablo stable branch and ditching the skips, but we just have to be visible on that decision as well. For now should I just remove the skip?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-27 21:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Use "compute" as catalog name for nova.

With the obsolete catalog name, many tests fail with:

  EndpointNotFound: Endpoint not found
  Details: nova

Change-Id: I74af3083810dabf4c5389c351c792c41b35b8d23

When trying to run tests I get:


AssertionError: There is no script for 77 version

Hmmm, thats really weird since this commit doesn't touch migration files. Why would that be happening. It seemed to run fine for me when I ran the tests. Odd."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-13 23:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Joe: I have seen errors like the above if I have a leftover .pyc from a different branch that is adding migrations.  Try cleaning out your pyc files.  I have a git alias to help clean out pyc files and regenerate ctags:

[alias]
    cc = !"TOP=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); find $TOP -name '*.pyc' -delete; ctags -R $TOP; git-checkout"'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-02-13 23:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Re-adds ssl to kombu configuration and adds flags that are needed to pass through to kombu.

Implements part of blueprint ssl-endpoints

Adds in configuration options:

kombu_ssl_version (ssl version)
kombu_ssl_keyfile (ssl keyfile)
kombu_ssl_certfile (ssl certfile)
kombu_ssl_ca_certs (ssl ca certfile)

This adds onto rabbit_use_ssl (which must be True for the above to have any effect) and allows
users to specify in greater detail (more than just True/False) how SSL is going to be configured.

Change-Id: I2186a6aa9397df857321324bf4007bc8310b85ce

'}]
commit_message:
XML de/serialization (bug 928058)

Middleware rewrites incoming XML requests as JSON, and outgoing JSON as
XML, per Accept and Content-Type headers.

Tests assert that core API methods support WADL/XSD specs, and cover
JSON content as well.

Change-Id: I6897971dd745766cbc472fd6e5346b1b34d933b0

  - /dev/vdb is actually where the ephemeral drives live, so to avoid conflicts I bumped them to /dev/vdc

commit_message:
Update Swift configuration with keystone latest.

- Update Swift to use the new tokenauth and swift_auth from keystone.
- Drop swift-keystone2.
- Add swift3 / s3token in swift proxy pipeline (TODO: figure out
testing).
- Fix exercises/swift.sh (workaround until review #3712 get merged).

Change-Id: Ie85d30e14cee21c6f80043fccde92dfb229f0e80

commit_message:
Prevent a possible divide by 0 in obj/auditor.py.

Fixes bug 941731. If 'elapsed=0' in audit_all_objects set it
to 0.000001 to avoid divide by 0.

Change-Id: If0b43568033167818c482c8927863bea1dccfe57

formatting changes to the Keystone /ec2tokens extension.

"}]
commit_message:
Update EC2KeystoneAuth to grab tenant 'id'.

Updates the EC2KeystoneAuth middleware so that it supports
formatting changes to the Keystone /ec2tokens extension.
Instead of setting project_id to a tenant dict this change
correctly sets it to an id.

Fixes LP Bug #941119.

Change-Id: I318ed594929162eafb5d7c3d8b9583cb109b73d4

commit_message:
Q-Admin minor fixes

- link to Nova admin guide for floating IPs pointed to cactus docs.
Updated to point to diablo docs.

- Keystone changed their 'keystone-manage' tool to use 'list_tenants', not
'tenant list'.  Update our example.

- Also note that Keystone IDs are now UUIDs, not integers.

Change-Id: I290734bdde671777b3d0610ed52505101b34cc57

commit_message:
Config code cleanups

 * Global config.CONF removed
 * Opt definitions moved to where they're used
 * Sync the opt defaults in code and sample config
 * Opt registration wrappers removed from keystone.config
 * ConfigMixin removed from keystone.config
 * Generic PasteDeploy factories copied from glance which pass a
   ConfigOpts to the app and filter constructors

Change-Id: Ida96f11356103258e67769c6a6e371b6f6bbf71b

commit_message:
Makes novaclient use the volumes endpoint

 * Depends on https://review.openstack.org/#change,4479
 * Adds support to change service type including tests
 * Adds decorator for methods that need to use another service type
 * Changes volume and snapshots to use the volume endpoint
 * These extensions will move into the volume client once it exists
 * Fixes bug 940017

Change-Id: I683e4ca6c67e278d8aa8a9acec3dc0f1872f43f2

commit_message:
Fixed nova-manage floating command syntax.

nova-manage floating create/destroy no longer seem to take a hostname
argument. Removed it from doc.

Addresses
http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/admin/content/associating-public-ip.html#comment-332898216

Implementation of nova-manage floating create for Diablo is here:
 * https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/2011.3.1/bin/nova-manage#L689

Change-Id: I1d8ee74d78b3720020848ef650fbf0ed98f72f39

subject: Update EC2 Keystone Auth so it grabs user name.
messages:
[{'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-02-25 16:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan, this concerns me.  Are you sure the openstack api path for nova using the name instead of the ID?

ID is the unique immutable identifier
NAME is unique but mutable'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-25 17:50:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jesse:

Just to be sure I added a log statement to NovaKeystoneContext (in api/auth.py) to log the user_id right before we create the RequestContext. It is getting set to 'admin'.

Additionally nova has always used the name as the internal key right?

mysql> select distinct(user_id) from instances;
+---------+
| user_id |
+---------+
| admin   |
+---------+

------

I agree that ideally name would be mutable. So perhaps we should go the other way..."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-02-25 18:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

need to pull in a few others to get opinions.

ID is probably some long LDAP thing:
  uid=dprince,ou=employees,dc=redhat,dc=com 

or a UUID

whereas the name will be dprince or dan or mrprince or princey or ..  whatever you want to use that week'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-25 18:41:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Lets go ahead and take 'princey' out of the list. ;)"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-25 19:43:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Haven't had a chance to look into this one yet, but my initial response is it should be the other way around. I think we should be using user id everywhere."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-25 20:31:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay. I see the issue here.

X_USER_ID isn't getting set in the auth_token middleware.

That middleware seems to be a source of major regression in the KSL merge. I'm going to thow up a quick fix... but we need to put some proper functional tests in place on that very important piece of the keystone integration soon."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-25 20:31:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-25 15:46:41.000000000', 'message': "Update EC2 Keystone Auth so it grabs user name.

commit_message:
Update EC2 Keystone Auth so it grabs user name.

Updates the EC2KeystoneAuth middleware so that it grabs the
user name instead of the user ID from keystone responses.
This fixes some subtle differences that can occur across the EC2
and Openstack API's when using Keystone.

Fixes LP Bug #940977.

Change-Id: If1085765ca347492fb90a81947e330cb8fc1c81e

[{'created': '2012-02-24 15:17:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed nova-manage floating command syntax.

nova-manage floating create/destroy no longer seem to take a hostname
argument. Removed it from doc.

Addresses
http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/admin/content/associating-public-ip.html#comment-332898216

Implementation of nova-manage floating create for Diablo is here:
 * https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/2011.3.1/bin/nova-manage#L689

Change-Id: Ib4ee853e5a7489dcd7586ab2f0738809d9fcb85c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed nova-manage floating command syntax.

nova-manage floating create/destroy no longer seem to take a hostname
argument. Removed it from doc.

Addresses
http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/admin/content/associating-public-ip.html#comment-332898216

Implementation of nova-manage floating create for Diablo is here:
 * https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/2011.3.1/bin/nova-manage#L689

Change-Id: Ib4ee853e5a7489dcd7586ab2f0738809d9fcb85c

[{'created': '2012-02-25 18:16:09.000000000', 'message': 'Return appropriate error for invalid-port state in create port API.

Fixes ovs-plugin to return appropriate error code when create port API is passed a port state value other than ACTIVE or DOWN. Fixes bug 919265.

Also added unit-test to test the behavior and verified it using ovs-plugin with devstack.

Change-Id: Ibd4e7bfdf4483c7ad1ef4ca70a336cb164493ae1
'}]
commit_message:
Return appropriate error for invalid-port state in create port API.

Fixes ovs-plugin to return appropriate error code when create port API is passed a port state value other than ACTIVE or DOWN. Fixes bug 919265.

Also added unit-test to test the behavior and verified it using ovs-plugin with devstack.

Change-Id: Ibd4e7bfdf4483c7ad1ef4ca70a336cb164493ae1

commit_message:
Create tools/sample_data.sh

Based on devstack's files/keystone_data.sh, sample_data.sh creates
the same set of tenants/users/roles/etc.  It can eventually be used
by devstack as the bootstrap script.

Fixes bug 934331

Change-Id: Ib3b514b6e4fc5c9e980e4e0c59bc44cda1b8d2b6

messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 19:20:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Needs Information:

What are the speed implications of this?  IIRC the disk version of the test is incredibly slow."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It makes it slower no doubt. But I'm not sure there is anyway around it. I have a hunch that its a timing thing where the Engine is "reconnecting". Which would make sense seeing as Smokestack is intermittently having issues with this test as well. Any suggestions as to alternative workarounds would be appreciated.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:27:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Maybe we should just disable the test for now? One possibility is having a separate set of longer tests that wouldn't run by default."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:35:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is this a strict dependency for your other branch?   Doesn't seem like it should be.."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No its not a strict dep. Just one that makes it more likely to pass smokestack.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 23:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 23:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-24 23:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Updated Skip and commit comment.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-25 00:24:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

This is connected to http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=72

addressed by this fix:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/run_tests.sh#L188

Seems your virutalenv is a little bit different:
/home/jkoelker/.virtualenvs/nova/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/reflection.py

So that run_tests.sh patch does not work.

A suggested solution could be use 'find' command in 
run_test.sh to find the __init__.py to patch."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-25 00:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

nasty that we have to patch it.

How about
$target=`python -c "from migrate.versioning import util; print util.__file__[:-1]"`'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-25 00:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Great!'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-25 00:37:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

and virtualenv, what will happen?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-25 00:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

ah, good point.  it needs a {$wrapper} then it will get it from the proper place.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-02-25 01:59:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-24 16:45:55.000000000', 'message': "Do not use memory databases for migration tests

Something in the migrate decorators are causing a new engine to be
created. With memory db's this will be a new database outside of
migrate's control. This sets the sqlite db path which is what glance
does as well.

Fixes the sqlite migration for version 078. Renaming a temporary table
does not keep that table after the connection closes.

Fixes LP940407

commit_message:
Monkey patch migrate < 0.7.3

* Works around migrate issue 72 [1] by monkey patching migrate prior
  to import.
* Removes previous workaround
* Refactor test config to work under nosetests directly
* Fixes LP940407

1: https://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=72

Change-Id: I219e4cecf8bb2e34ae238ac270428f496378ee61

subject: Clean stale lockfiles on service startup : fixes bug 785955
messages:
[{'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-24 19:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Apart from code and logic, need some feedback on whether this is the correct place to hook in at service startup, or should we just add this to the Service class ?'}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-24 19:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 19:48:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I think this could be done during startup in the service class.
Also, is it necessary to have KNOWN_LOCKS?  all of our locks are prefixed with nova- so can't we just match against nova-*.lock?  That would prevent us from having to maintain the list of locks separately."}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-24 21:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This patch set moves the lock cleanup to service startup, and eliminates the need for lock names - all locks are cleaned automatically.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 22:33:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I guess there is one issue with doing it in service, it will run multiple times (especially in nova-all). Not a huge issue.  I think you also need to add it to the WSGIService start method as not all of the workers (nova-api for example) are Services."}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-24 23:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-02-24 23:16:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This patch set adds the cleanup call to WSGIService.start()

The code is written to assume it will be run concurrently from multiple process and threads, and should be safe in those scenarios.  It's a shame to run it multiple times, but this should help eliminate process hangs when restarting one service.  

The real fix is to get a smarter lock manager in place, so we can add timeouts and reliable lock breaking."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-25 00:56:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

i'm ok with this version.  Thanks."}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-02-25 01:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-25 01:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1824/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1570/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1197/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2951/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-25 01:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Clean stale lockfiles on service startup : fixes bug 785955

Adds cleanup_files_locks() to nova/utils, which cleans up stale locks
left behind after process failures.

Adds a call to clean up locks on service startup for nova-api, nova-cert,
nova-compute, nova-network, nova-objectstore, and nova-scheduler.

Adds tools/clean_file_locks.py, which can be used to manually clean
stale locks.

Change-Id: I752e0b24d3c7fc5f1dc290da355cbd7f430789b8

Not mounted: sdy on http://172.24.0.150:6000/recon/unmounted
Why the url? Could it just be the IP?

With the disk usage, the second column needs another character these days (lotsa drives in our clusters) and the graph column will need correspondingly one less character.

With the quarantine report, the formatting seems all over the place.

Not for this commit, but for the future: Can there be an option to report which items are the low and high? I know I can run verbose and search through that looking for it, but it seems like a common thing to do.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-01-20 22:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-01-22 08:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
swift-recon cli cleanup

Refactored swift-recon completely. It's broken out into Classes and no
longer uses globals. In addition, I pulled out the previous individual
scout_XXXX functions that where getting added for each check. All the
check's now use the same method from the Scout class to obtain their
stats and telemtry. Also, added docstrings and tried to be more pylint
compliant.

Change-Id: I52a5f56950c07a1f0681f25ee0e6667aa9a9bdec

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-24 23:09:47.000000000', 'message': "Swift name usage cleanup. Unicode support and slash prohibition.

Ensures end-to-end support for unicode characters w/ swift in all
places where cloudfiles supports it. (patch submitted to fix cloudfiles).

Also makes sure that the forward-slash character is not allowed in
container or object names since it's a reserved character in swift.

Fixes bug 889564 and fixes bug 940689.

Change-Id: I259eb04f2f8854d43d1df28876d34b237a21fa9a
"}]
commit_message:
Swift name usage cleanup. Unicode support and slash prohibition.

Ensures end-to-end support for unicode characters w/ swift in all
places where cloudfiles supports it. (patch submitted to fix cloudfiles).

Also makes sure that the forward-slash character is not allowed in
container or object names since it's a reserved character in swift.

Fixes bug 889564 and fixes bug 940689.

Change-Id: I259eb04f2f8854d43d1df28876d34b237a21fa9a

commit_message:
Help output tweaks, Vol I

Fixes bug 936399 and bug 936424

* Refer to 'Identiy API' rather than 'Keystone API'
* 'keystone help' and 'keystone --help' now produce the same output,
  the list of sub-commands
* updates README

Change-Id: I179149807a0aa66947e4ac17ad2839a653a55888

commit_message:
Don't delete security group in use from OS API.

Fix bug 938853.

This patch adds a check to the OpenStack API so that a security group
still in use can not be deleted.  This same check just recently went in
for the EC2 API.

Change-Id: I75dc47c5f5d227b94c45ba8a0f00c37bd63f09fc

commit_message:
Wait for VM to stop before deleting security group.

Related to bug 938853.

The patch for this bug prevents deleting security groups through the
OpenStack API if they are still in use.  This patch for devstack updates
the floating_ips exercise script to wait until the VM has stopped before
deleting the security group.

Change-Id: If42f85934c2b92d4d001c419cabb09e2e3dc1aae

commit_message:
Example config_drive init script, label the config drive

Configuration with DHCP & cloud-init can be painful.  The config_drive is great,
and it avoids disk injection, but there's no example of how to use it.

So here's a little example init.d script for contrib, and a code patch to make
sure the config drive gets a nice volume label.

Change-Id: I22a1d6a824856ca9651b435d0fe54e348ab107fe

subject: Copy data when migration dst is on a different FS
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 706, 'name': 'Brian Lamar', 'email': 'brian.lamar@rackspace.com', 'username': 'blamar'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 23:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Couple of commit msg nits, other than that, looks good."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-24 00:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I still think this is unnecessary.

If you change the default SR (and I doubt this is common at all) then change the symlink for /images at the same time.

Your patch ignores more common misconfigurations, such as /images being on the root filesystem, for less common configurations, like changing the default SR.

If fixing migrations to not use /images is not possible for essex, then I don't see what's wrong with the current code which fails fast and clearly."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-02-24 01:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-02-24 01:14:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good point on the commit message, Rick.

Johannes:

I definitely don't like the fact that it is likely for a deployer to have /images set up on a 'too-small' root partition, especially if they actually did not set it up and it was simply created by the rsync in the migration. But I don't want to just break acceptable diablo deployments in the name of failing fast.

Perhaps we could implement init_host in xenapi_conn.py to call a new migration plugin function that checks to see if /images is created an on a sufficiently large device? This would fail even faster (without destroying a perfectly good vm as well!) and would allow us to give really informative error messages."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-24 01:33:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I don't think having /images on the root partition is acceptable at all. It will only work for trivial setups. Like instances that haven't been used much (development, testing, etc) and have small VHDs. It will break when the VHDs become bigger, because of larger disks (and thusly more filesystem metadata) or when the instances get used (and the VHDs start growing as holes get filled).

It's obvious that /images should never have been used in the first place given all of the problems it has caused.

That said, I wouldn't block a check to make sure /images is configured reasonably, but it seems like this is all a lot of effort for setups that would break quickly the first time they try a migration.

I'm sure there are more significant bugs that deserve our attention than this."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-24 14:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This seems reasonable to me. The link to the http://bugs.python.org helps give context around the original issue we hit too.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-24 16:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-24 16:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1808/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1567/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1194/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2948/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-24 16:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

subject: Added a copyright line for me.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 357, 'name': 'Devin Carlen', 'email': 'devin@openstack.org', 'username': 'devcamcar'}, {'_account_id': 706, 'name': 'Brian Lamar', 'email': 'brian.lamar@rackspace.com', 'username': 'blamar'}, {'_account_id': 998, 'name': 'Naveed Massjouni', 'email': 'naveedm9@gmail.com', 'username': 'ironcamel'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

LOL'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:40:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'm sure you've written code before 2012 so unless you meant to give up the copyright to the code you've written before 2012, I'll -1 this patch for now."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:40:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

But seriously folks, whats the criteria for getting your name up here? I'd like to know."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If anything the copyright would go to your employer, and not you.'}, {'account_id': 998, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

awesome'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Have you edited all of these files? That's the minimum."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-09 00:55:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Thanks Joe, I'm going to get with our legal department tomorrow to see if I need to add the company name or if they're willing to give me the copyright. Either way I'll -2 this for the time being."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-09 01:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@bcwaldon: Patch Set 2 will be more accurate, and was generated with the following script:

for NAME in `find nova -name "*.py"`; do git blame $NAME | grep -i Lamar &> /dev/null; if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo $NAME; fi; done | xargs sed -i -e 's/# All Rights Reserved./# Copyright 2012 Brian Lamar\n# All Rights Reserved./''}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-09 01:10:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-20 08:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The way I think about this is:

 * If I have made a non-trivial modification to the file, I may place a Copyright notice covering my contribution
 * If I have made this change as part of my employment, I think it's fair to assume my employer holds the copyright
 * It is sufficient to just use the current year in the Copyright notice, not a range of years

The question of whether your employer holds the copyright to your code is a complicated one and depends on your employment agreement and local laws. At Red Hat, if a developer is concerned about the ambiguity, we can request copyright assignment either to or from Red Hat

If you're confident that the copyright is yours, I'd be fine with the change. Otherwise, I had assumed that Rackspace had assigned copyright to "OpenStack LLC" and Rackspace employee contributions were covered by that.

The question of whether you've made a non-trivial contribution to every one of the files you're changing is something else worth checking. Personally, if it was me, I'd just add my copyright notices to files I modify in future rather than adding it to all existing files.'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-02-24 01:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not submit

'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-24 16:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I got the answer I was looking for. There have been no official PPB rulings on person or company copyright lines including decisions on formatting and content. I encourage all individual contributors and companies to add their name and the current year to the top of all files they produce.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-24 14:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extraneous _validate_claims() arg.

Extraneous env argument to:

  keystone.middleware.auth_token.AuthProtocol._validate_claims()

causes glance failure when keystone auth strategy is enabled:

  File "/opt/stack/keystone/keystone/middleware/auth_token.py", line 309, in _validate_claims
    return self._validate_claims(env, claims, False)
  NameError: global name '\''env'\'' is not defined

Seen when running devstack on Fedora16.

Change-Id: Ia04c14a709e3b332002dc6cddcda56e247821fa5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extraneous _validate_claims() arg.

Extraneous env argument to:

  keystone.middleware.auth_token.AuthProtocol._validate_claims()

causes glance failure when keystone auth strategy is enabled:

  File "/opt/stack/keystone/keystone/middleware/auth_token.py", line 309, in _validate_claims
    return self._validate_claims(env, claims, False)
  NameError: global name '\''env'\'' is not defined

Seen when running devstack on Fedora16.

Change-Id: Ia04c14a709e3b332002dc6cddcda56e247821fa5

commit_message:
Set PolicyNotAuthorized Return Code

Change PolicyNotAuthorized code to 403 in exceptions
Catch exceptions for PolicyNotAuthorized in compute, volume, network api and return webob.exc.HTTPForbidden()

Fixes bug 917897

Change-Id: I010aac0e7cb2d47a4c6e4b9603bf45734a6bb196

subject: Set error code for PolicyNotAuthorized to 401
messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 03:54:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This should be 403, 401 signifies that a user needs to login, whereas PolicyNotAuthorized means they have logged in but they aren't allowed to perform the action."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-24 03:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Also, it should inherit the code from NotAuthorized, so there is something else amiss here.  I think There is a place in the wsgi stack where the exception needs to be caught and turned into a webob.exc.HTTPForbidden()'}, {'account_id': 53, 'date': '2012-02-24 05:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Accidentally opened a new change:
https://review.openstack.org/#change,4490'}]

subject: Force reclone if git repo exist but branch differs
messages:
[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-02-23 15:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This should have no effect on the devstack integration tests in Jenkins (where the repo exists and is in detached HEAD state, but RECLONE is not set).'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-23 21:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-23 21:43:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'm not sure I understand the motivation for this change.  When I run with RECLONE off it is because I am managing the branches myself and don't want things to change out from under me.  Help me understand why this is a good thing."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-02-23 22:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

You're right Dean, I misread the patch thinking it only applied with RECLONE set and was completely backwards in my assessment.  This would break integration test gating because we depend on being able to work from a git repo where HEAD is not a branch name.

Further, this would inhibit developers from running devstack with work-in-progress repos."}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-02-23 22:06:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I second dean's concern.  It seems like this could inadvertently delete a user's code (specifically my code, given my devstack workflow) from a working directory."}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-02-24 02:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for clearing this, I had the misunderstanding that devstack.sh will checkout to the proper branch if it's specified in localrc, I should have just set RECLONE=yes to have the same effect instead of patching this."}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-02-24 02:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

set RECLONE=yes will have same effect, this change is pointless'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-23 05:28:04.000000000', 'message': 'Force reclone if git repo exist but branch differs

Change-Id: I7fee0354035b265fcbf1daaa27f0da986ee9581e
'}]

commit_message:
Improve usability of CLI.

  * Fixes bug #936422
  * Fixes bug #932223
  * Depends on bcwaldon's review: https://review.openstack.org/#change,4305
  * This review proposes making changes outlined in this spreadsheet:
    https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Ak6TA47h_6fwdGZwRE5WWEJBdEhnckpMTG5RcWFjY3c#gid=0
    This cleans up the CLI, normalizing commands and arguments, correcting
    optional and required arguments and flags.
  * included https://review.openstack.org/4270 here per Brian's request

  Note that some commands have changed names to conform to noun-verb form:
  user-update-password  ->  user-password-update
  add-user-role  ->  user-role-add
  remove-user-role  ->  user-role-remove
  ec2-create-credentials  ->  ec2-credentials-create
  ec2-list-credentials  ->  ec2-credentials-list
  ec2-delete-credentials  ->  ec2-credentials-delete
  token  ->  token-get

Change-Id: I8128fa105a1b8002199211f9e475b1a7a6229b8c
